E yu mbena ka'. E fúú efa rkwe aèmboè e m laèa naè. Vúè neè yá mbe dïì' ce yi gúèú yi mú noêñ.	He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.
Bfee Nyúè ce weèr ce laèa na yu ba vi bfee ce vi m ba aè bsúèti, beèe a m rïìñ ka'. Tá Nyúè ka' keè geèe ñgoèñ ca, e m kwaè'shi wáá, a lá ená e be geèe buu ca tá seèe bo túr ñgúè' moè' efa yi foèo.	But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery, the wisdom that has been hidden, which God foreordained before the worlds for our glory,
E beesïì a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Máè suñ weèe wáá, weèe aè ce yu' ka'. Weèe ce koèñ ená m ker suñ weèe njoká? Weâe koèñ aè rba ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu foñ a?”	"He answered them, ""I told you already, and you didn't listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don't also want to become his disciples, do you?"""

Bkaŋ bwoo bvi ruu a?	Are your pans full?

Jisoès aè beesïì enáê, “Maè'shi tá yi ba wa'a seè'ni na. Yi yu boèñboñ ená seèe gee ca tá seèe bo geèe buu wááwá ce vi yu yáánïì.” Joân aè byemïì.	"But Jesus, answering, said to him, ""Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness."" Then he allowed him."
Pitaè aè du a yeâ mbuèu, a ba yi encaèñ. E du a ba' mbe cuèu mambe ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì, a niñ mbo, a cu aè nsheè a beèe ce a m ce keè'ni Ndap Nyúè, tá e bo yá yuu ce yi be ba. njobeè' le rbyemïì li be lúèsi neè rluèñ ce weèe ce keè' aè rkonïì naè.	receiving the result of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
Baná seèe yoñshi Nyúè aè rlii Jisoès. Liseèe ryoèñshïìì anaè li be ba aèmboè tañshïì ce seèe aè geèe neè Nyúè wa'a. Seèe yoñshi ye neè viseèe mnjeèndoñ aè njïû yáánïì. Mɛ̀ saa blabaʼ ese ye.	I bought shoes from him on credit.
Wáè loèr yo yu ená aède' aè duñshïì mnfeèp nduunjïì. AÈ ce laèa wáná aè yu rraa neè beèe ce a yu aè túè'nji.	and are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness,
Josáèf aè du a yuu cáâ' boèñboñ, a suusi gúâú ñwáè embe kïìntaa, a kur neè cáè' anaè a lá njep rsheè ce a m soè' nje ryáá. A ka' láè a biñsi ma luèr a cete ncuèu rsheè aègho.	He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
Yú' ce weèe aè m koni naè yu ba yú' ce yi geèe weèe aè ba bkwaèa tá weèe bo ce wáp buu ka', yu ba yú' ce yi geèe weèe aè ba ba boo Nyúè. Father!"""

Rïìñ neè ená beèe ce a ce saèki ba beèe ce a ce loo neè mnyúè enjep ñgoèñ na, ba beèe ce a ce koo bbyeèñge beèe mo', káè mmbañruè mo' áè, ba mmbañruè ce a ce koo mmbañruè mo',	Or don't you know that the unrighteous will not inherit the Kingdom of God? Saimún Pitaè ba ñwáè yá'ni yïì buu moè' a m duè aèmbuèu Jisoès aè nfeè' anaè. Ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì aè m rïìñ ñwáè yá'ni buu Jisoès anaè. E niñ a Jisoès mbe mambe ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì anaè.	Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;
AÈde' weèr ke laa nyúè moè' ená weèr yu aèmboè beèe ce a ce kwaè'shi ená a yu beâe bgoèrgoèr naè ka'. AÈde' weèr fe'nïì yer ñger aè yap ka'. Woweèe a ce feè'ni yap ñger fa waâp mú wa'a, baná woweèe a yu blúr.	For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves. But they themselves, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are without understanding.
Kaifaès aè m ce laèa wa'a, a ce laèa ba aè mkwaè'shïì mi ka'. AÈmboè Kaifaès ca aè m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì aè feè' anaè, e m suñ beèe yuu ce yi be loè ba. E m laèa ená Jisoès táá aè rkwe aètu to' wááwá.	Now he didn't say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
Ñkaraè, fa beè'ni yuu bebep ka', beè'ni ba yuu boèñboñ. Ñwáè ce e ka' ce geèe yuu boèñboñ baná ñgaèñ yu ñwáè Nyúè. Ñwáè ce e ka' ce gee yuu bebep, baná ñgaèñ aè m yá Nyúè ka'.	Beloved, don't imitate that which is evil, but that which is good. He who does good is of God. He who does evil hasn't seen God.
Wèr à yɛ ye kaʼ, banɛ e bii vʉ̀.	We havenʼt seen him, therefore he is yet to come.
AÈmboè weèr aè rïìñ seè'ni ená weèe táá tatap njep Tata na, weèr be cu seè'ni yáánïì.	For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord.
AÈ be keè lu'shi, yu' rboèñ, tá beèe magoèr a lu'shi foñ, aè nfeè' ce a bi muu anaè,	You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.
Yuu mo'sir yi yu ená yeè ndeèe ba le rcu li ku ba yáánïì aèmboè Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ Jisoès ce roèo ená li ba, ka' máè ka' vú yá weèe, káè máè vúè ka' áè, m bo kuè yu' máná weèe táá tatap, a túr rkwaè'shïû rmo'sir, a ker ce reè neè ntee mo'sir tá Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ ce weèe aè byemi aègho bo duè kuèntombïì. Ñwáè rsa' moè' aè m bipshi neè ye enáê, “Ñwáè ryá'nïì ce mboèñmboñ, yuu ce aède' m gee ka' koni ryoèñ ce nfeseè yu ká?”	"A certain ruler asked him, saying, ""Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?"""
Ñwáè anaè ka' ku bii nteèe, nlaè' rkwe anaè yi túr ñger ka'. Yi ku túr ñger ba aè nfeè' ce ñwáè anaè aè kwe.	For a will is in force where there has been death, for it is never in force while he who made it lives.
E m laèa enáê, “Weèr aè m laèa ená weèe fa yá'ni yuu mo' aè rlii ñwáè anaè ka'. Yá laè neè yuu ce weèe aè geèe. njobeè' Nyúè ku ba moè'sir caè'caè'. E be geèe Jus ce a ke geèe búè naè aèmboè beâe byáánïì, ce woweèe a ka' byemi neè Jisos Kraêis. Yi ku ba wa' foñ neè beèe ce a ke geèe búè ka' naè. Beèe a lapnïì goèr seê, tu yïû goèr yi wáp ená a be koo Pol saèsi. E laa neè bsoogáè ená woweèe a du koo ye aè ñger niñ aègho mbe barakïì. AÈ m ba aè nfeè' entombïì e ba yuu cicïì neè wáè; seè'ni e yu lulu neè wáè ker ba neè máè foñ.	who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me.
Caè'ni neè bfúr ce aè rla' Laèodisïìyaè neè máè, ker ca'ni Nimfaè ba beèe ce a ke niñ cor mbe yeâ ndaèp naè foñ.	Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly that is in his house.
Ndoèo aè co' weèe ce mnfeèp ce weèe ce duèñshi beèe nduunjïì. Weèe ce laèa weená ñwáè aè ka' ye leè', kaa aè rlii Ndap Nyúè, yïì anaè ba yuu ka'; ñwáè aè ka' ye leè', kaa ba aè rlii buu embe Ndaèp Nyúè ce a geèe neè njáèá bco' mo' ce a too ená guêl, baná leè' anaè yi kur ñgaèñ.	"Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, 'Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	17	Weèe ce weèe yu blúr, a ba mnfeèp, yuu ce yi yu goèr yu ba yïû fá? Yu ba buu embe Ndaèp Nyúè ce a geèe neè gul káè yu ba Ndap Nyúè ce e geèe buu ca aè ba buu Nyúè?	You blind fools! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	18	Weèe ce laèa foñ ená ñwáè aè ka' ye leè', kaa aè rlii dïû' ntoèo rfa, yïì anaè ba yuu ka'; ñwáè aè ka' ye leè', kaa ba aè rlii rfa embe dïû' ntoèo rfa, leè' anaè yi kur ye.	Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated?'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	19	Weèe yu mnfeèp ghup. Yuu ce yi yu goèr yu ba yïû fá? Yu ba rfa káè yu ba dïû' ntoèo rfa ce yi geèe rfa li ba yuu Nyúè?	You blind fools! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	20	Baná ñwáè ce e ka' ye leè', kaa aè rlii dïû' ntoèo rfa baná e kaèa aè rlii dïû' ntoèo rfa ba aè rlii buu embo.	He therefore who swears by the altar, swears by it, and by everything on it.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	21	Ñwáè aè ka' ye leè', kaa aè rlii Ndap Nyúè, baná e kaèa aè rlii Ndap Nyúè ba aè rlii ñwáè ce e ce cu mbo.	He who swears by the temple, swears by it, and by him who was living in it.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	22	Ñwáè ce e ka' ye leè', kaa aè rlii rbuu, baná e kaa aè rlii kaèbaèraè' Nyúè, ba aè rlii ñwáè ce e cu mbo.	He who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God, and by him who sits on it.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	23	23	Ndoèo aè co' weèe ce ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir, ba beèe Farïìsïî. Weèe yu ñgaâa mbo'ni. Wee ke fa ñgúè' moè'sir efa rrúú efa mú buu jáá jáèá jáá ce a ke láè njep njaèp. Ka' yi yu wa'a, weèe aè loèr buu mncir Nyúè ce vi yu tatap a caa rfa anaè aètáèr. Buu anaè yu aè rgeèe ñgeâe mini, ba ñkoosimnse ker ba aè rba mini aè buu. Weèe aè ba geèe buu ca keèr geèe mmo' ca foñ.	Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. But you ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone."
Ngur saʼ à watî.	The knife handle has broken.
faè dïì' yuu yi bo ba ce a taa weèe aètu mo ka', tá wee mntee vi ba brara. Geèe neè wa'a tá weèe bo ba boo Nyúè ce a túr faèa ka', a ce cu aè múè ñgaâa bsaèrbuu, a ce raa aè waâp mú aèmboè mkaèñsïì wa'a.	that you may become blameless and harmless, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you are seen as lights in the world,
E ka' laèa wa'a, a mú' waêp bfee, tá woweèe a bo rïìñ buu ce Ñwaâ' Nyúè yi ce laèa.	Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
AÈ ka' ba njo' Jisos Kraêis, Nyúè aè naa seèe mbekïì aèbee seèe woweèe, a gee seèe woweèe aè cu mbe buèu.	and raised us up with him, and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
AÈ ka' ba aè mmbomntaa Nyúè ekoâ, to' bïìi yi ku roèo fúú wááwá aè ryu' blaâa Nyúè.	The next Sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.
Yi ka' ba wa'a, Jisoès aè laa enáê, “Be ba aè nfeè' ce weèe aè naèa Muu Ñwáè mbekïì tá weèe ka' rïìñ ená a máè ye, keèr rïìñ foñ ená m ce geèe yuu mo' a máâ ñger ka'. M ku ce laèa ba buu ce yaè Ta aè yá'ni máè.	"Jesus therefore said to them, ""When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things."
AÈ m ba nyúè moè', Jisoès aè ce geèe rloo mimñgi', ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu a ba a ye. E bipshïì neè woweèe enáê, “Ku' beèe ce a ke vúè na, a ke laèa ená m yu nda?”	"It happened, as he was praying alone, that the disciples were with him, and he asked them, ""Who do the multitudes say that I am?"""
Weèe aè m ba aèmbo njeèe ce yi daè', aè ka' ba seè'ni weèe aè kútïì a ce duè ba aèmbuèu ñwáè ncïìñ njeèe ce e ce keè'ni weèe.	For you were going astray like sheep; but now have returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.
Máè suñ woweèe wo blaèa; ñgoèñ yi baèa woweèe njobeè' woweèe a yu beèe enjep ñgoèñ ka', aèmboè má máè yu ñwáè enjep ñgoèñ ka' naè.	I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
M ce suñ wáè ená aè be kuè cu mbe shañ anaè caar, laè' yi mbaèa ce yi yu neè wáè wááwá ka' fúú embo.”	"I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny."""
Woweèe a ker bipshi neè ye enáê, “Baná a wáè nda? A wáè AÈlajaè a?” E beesïì enáê, “A máè AÈlajaè ka'.” Woweèe a ker bipshi enáê, “A wáè ñwáè ncep ntuu Nyúè anaè a?” Joân aè kanïì.	"They asked him, ""What then? Are you Elijah?"" He said, ""I am not."" ""Are you the prophet?"" He answered, ""No."""
Woweèe wááwá a wáp, a ku'si Nyúè, a ce laèa enáê, “Ñwáâ ncep ntuu Nyúâ ñgoèr aè fúú efa seâe mú,” a ker ce laèa enáê, “Nyúè aè vúè aè rjaè' yïì beèe.”	"Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, ""A great prophet has arisen among us!"" and, ""God has visited his people!"""
E loʼ mɛ̀.	He has deceived me.

Geewa'a, m ce lu'shi seè'ni, a ke' ce lu'shi njobeè' máè m geèe weèe aè koosïìmnse ka', m ce lu'shi njobeè' weèe aè m koosimnse wa'a, a kupse, a ma' yeè buu bbebep. Ñkoosimnse ce weèe aè m túr, yu njáèá ñkoosimnse ce Nyúè koèñ. Weèr aè m bepsi weèe bepsi ka' koo múcaèr.	I now rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that you were made sorry to repentance. Now I desire to have you all speak with other languages, but rather that you would prophesy. For he is greater who prophesies than he who speaks with other languages, unless he interprets, that the assembly may be built up.
Geèe neè ñgeâe boèñboñ neè beèe moè', koosimnse neè woweèe, foosi woweèe foñ aèmboè Nyúè aè m foèosi weèe njo' Jisos Kraâis naè.	And be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving each other, just as God also in Christ forgave you.
Ñwáè ce e ka' ce geèe yuu bebep baná ñgaèñ yu ñwáè Sataèn njobeè' Sataèn aè m geèe yuu bebep efa rkáè'. Mbuèu ce Muu Nyúè aè m vúè aè m ba ená e bo búsi mfaè' Sataèn.	He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. To this end the Son of God was revealed, that he might destroy the works of the devil.
Kuushi neè njáèá ntee boèñboñ ce Tata Jisoès aè m túr. E m ba ñwáè bkuè', a lo a kúti ñwáè fuèp njo' weèe, tá yïì fuèp ca bo geèe tá weèe túr bkuè'.	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that you through his poverty might become rich.
E m byáè' yi kïìntaa, a woweèe a du aè dïì' mo' ce a m ce too ená Dïì' keèkeèp tu. A too dïì' anaè aè li Hibruè ená Golgotaè.	"He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called ""The Place of a Skull,"" which is called in Hebrew, ""Golgotha,"""
E m yá'ni wa'a aè bfeâ' bbaa. Yi ka' ba wa', beèe wááwá aè ñgoâñ Ásïìyaè, Juês, ba beèe enje jáá a yu' blaèa Tataê.	This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
Jus magoèr a m beè' ñwaè' anaè njobeè' faèdïì' ce a m taa Jisoès naè aè m ba aè waâa la'. A m sañ ñwaè' anaè aè li Hibruè, ba aè li Latïìn ker ba aè li Greêk.	Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

Wáè ka' yá luèr ku túú kuèu njo, baná yi be yañ ba wáè.’	When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, 'Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? AÈ m ba aè nfeè' moè' weèe aè ce cu aè túè'nji, aè ka' ba seè'ni na, weèe aè ce cu ba aè rraa njobeè' weèe yu beèe Tata Jisoès. Geèe neè ñgeèe aèmboè beèe ce a ce cu aè rraa.	For you were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord. Walk as children of light,
Woweèe a ka' yu' ca, ntee yi bep woweèe seê, woweèe a ká' a ce ghaa a ce laèa enáê, “AÈtámïìs ce aè rla' Áfásoès yu nyúâ ñgoèr.”	"When they heard this they were filled with anger, and cried out, saying, ""Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!"""
E m káè' embe mñwaè' ce Musïìs aè m sañ, a du mbe mñwaè' ce ñgaâa ncep ntuu Nyúè wááwá a m sañ, a nashi buu ce Ñwaâ' Nyúè yi laèa aèmboè ye neè woweèe.	Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
Seèe aè ka' cu bteèe, seèe ku ce yu' ba ese Tataê. Seèe aè ka' kwe, baná seèe ku ba ba mba yeâ mmboè. Baná káè seèe aè cu bteèe áè, káè seèe aè kwe áè, seèe ku ba ba mbaè mmbo Tataê.	For if we live, we live to the Lord. Or if we die, we die to the Lord. If therefore we live or die, we are the Lord's.

Woweèe a ce ye, yap ntee yi ce fa woweèe ñgá', woweèe a ce kwaè'shi ená woweèe a geèe yuu bebep.	However, that knowledge isn't in all men. Ŋgàʼ e ke dòo mutù bòŋboŋ sê.	Ngah drives very well.

Wá ke yu' rboèñ neè buu ce beèe a ke fa neè wáè, too neè mor vi she ji' naè ka'. Wá ke yu' rboèñ neè btañshïì ce beèe a ke geèe tá vi bo siñsi yaèp buu bbebep naè ka'	You had no pleasure in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin.
Jisoès aè m ker laa buu neè woweèe aè mñgaèa. E m laèa enáê,	Jesus answered and spoke again in parables to them, saying,
Beèe wááwá ce a m yu' buu ce e m ce laèa, a m báèáñger aè ryu' aèmboè e m ce bipshi buu, a ker ce beèesi buu neè bfee-ñwáè.	All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
Mi mmir mi yu aèmboè mcuèñ mor wa'a. E soèp mtaa kúú mbe yeâ tuè aèñgoo. A sañ rlii mo' a yeâ nyoèr, aè ku riñ ba ye a riñ rlii anaè.	His eyes are a flame of fire, and on his head are many crowns. He has names written and a name written which no one knows but he himself.
Nyúè aè m geèe ená ñgoèñ mo' ce weèr aè suñ weèe ená yi be vúè naè, be sa' ba bcïìndap Nyúè ka'.	For he didn't subject the world to come, of which we speak, to angels.

Ñwáè aè ka' túr yuu ce aède' e lip ñguèñ aègho, baná má máè túr yuu anaè foñ. M be lïìp ñguèñ aègho. M ku bii ce laèa aèmboè lúr.	I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Baná yuu ce yi ghááte neè weèe aè rgeèe yi yu ená weèe lá ncir ce embe dïû' kúú Nyúè ce a m sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè enáê, “Koèñ nfúroè aèmboè wáè koèñ yoè nyor” naè.	"However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, ""You shall love your neighbor as yourself,"" you do well."
Tá beèe embe buèu wááwá a lu'shi njobeè' rla' Babiloèn li gweè. Tá beèe Nyúè wááwá, ba ñgaâa ntuu neè Jisoès, ker ba ñgaâa ncep ntuu Nyúè a lu'shi njobeè' Nyúè aè bepsi rla' ca njo' ñgá' ce li m ce fa neè woweèe.	Rejoice over her, O heaven, you saints, apostles, and prophets; for God has judged your judgment on her.
Wèr tʉr ndèe wèr woowèe mbà rò.	We have a boundary with them at the stream.
Baná m ce laèa neè weèe tatap seê, aè rlii Tata Jisoès ená weèe fa cu njáèá rcu ce beèe ce a rïìñ Nyúè ka' a ce cu naè ka'. Map mkwaè'shïì yu mkwaè'shïû cicïì.	This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,
M yu ñkwaèa neè ñwáè moè' ka'. Ka' m yu ñkwaèa neè ñwáè moè' ka' wa'a, máè geèe yaè nyor aèmboè ñkwaèa neè beèe wááwá tá m bo so beèe magoèr neè Jisos Kraêis.	For though I was free from all, I brought myself under bondage to all, that I might gain the more.
Bkúú ta efa múè bkúú saèamba ca a bii mbe kúú ka'. Ñkúú moè' ku bii sa', moè' aè ku bii vúè. E be vúè kuè sa' ba nfeè' múcaèr seê.	They are seven kings. Five have fallen, the one is, the other has not yet come. When he comes, he must continue a little while.
Yuu ce yi yu aètáèr a yïì efá? Yu ba aè rlaèa neè ñwáè yañ ca ená, ‘Máè foèosi wáè efa yoè buu bbebep’, ká aè rlaèa ená, ‘Lo mbekïì, lor yo keèñ, jáêr.’?	Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, 'Your sins are forgiven;' or to say, 'Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?'
E m vúè wa' foñ tá beèe enje jáá a bo yá, ku'si Nyúè njo' yïì ñkoosimnse. Yi ku ba aèmboè a sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè. A sañ mbo enáê, “Baná m be suñ aèmboè wáè aè múè beèe enje jáá, yoèp byáá ce ku'si lo rlii aègho.”	"and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy. As it is written, ""Therefore will I give praise to you among the Gentiles, and sing to your name."""
Blam vi be keèr raa aèfo ka. Mñkaè' bguèu vi be keèr ba aèfo ka'. AÈ m ba entoèmbïì ñgaâa ntaa ce aè rla' Babiloèn a ba beâe bgoèrgoèr njep ñgoèñ na, ma rla' anaè li ce bo' beâe aè bto' wááwá aè tú'.	The light of a lamp will shine no more at all in you. The voice of the bridegroom and of the bride will be heard no more at all in you; for your merchants were the princes of the earth; for with your sorcery all the nations were deceived.
Túè' moè' aè ka' keèr raa, Jisoès aè natïì ená e ce duè aè ñgoâñ Galeèleê. E m roèo Feleêp, a yá ye, a laa neè ye enáê, “Vúè fa máâ mbuèu.”	"On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him, ""Follow me."""
E tuu beèe a mmbaa efa waâp mú a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Duè neè aè múè rla', weèe be baè' tá weèe tarte weèe mbañruèñwáè moè' ce e byáè' ntúñ mdip. Duè neè fa yeâ mbuèu,	"He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, ""Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,"
‘A máè Nyúè wee btaê. A máè Nyúè Abraèham ba Aisïìk ba Jakoèp.’ Musïìs aè m kaèñ seê, a wáp aè rfyá'.	I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' Moses trembled, and dared not look.
Weèe ce geèe buu wááwá boèñboñ. Weèe túr rbyemïì tatap. Weèe rïìñ aè rsuñ buu Nyúè, weèe túr bfee aè buu mini, weèe aè koèñ aè rjaè' beèe, weèe aè koèñ weèr. Baná weèr ce koèñ werná weèe gee rfaâ' rboèñboñ ca boèñboñ foñ.	But as you abound in everything, in faith, utterance, knowledge, all earnestness, and in your love to us, see that you also abound in this grace.
Ncïìndap Nyúè moè' aè cu' ñgá' ce e m ba njep ghee yi mbenduè kaèbaèraè' nyaèa ce e m fúú enjep roè naè. E ka' cuè', túè' aè sii aè ñgoèñ wááwá ce nyaèa anaè aè m ce sa'. Beèe a m luushi mlee njo' mluè ce woweèe a m ce yá.	The fifth poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was darkened. They gnawed their tongues because of the pain,
Weèe aè ka' tá byemi yuu ce e m sañ ka', weèe ka' byemi yuu ce m ce laèa aè njáâá ká?”	"But if you don't believe his writings, how will you believe my words?"""
Woweèe a kur ye, a lor ye a du aègho, a fa neè Pailáèt ce e m ba govanoè.	and they bound him, and led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
Beèe moâ' aè ñgoâñ Ásïìyaè ce a m ba bkar Poêl, a m cep ntuu neè ye, a laa ená e fa moèo ka'.	Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' ce Nyúè aè m geèe mkaè'ni neè Abraèham naè, ñwáè moè' aè m ker ba ce e caèa ye ce Nyúè ka'. AÈ ka' ba wa'a, e kaa ba aè li rlii ená e be geèe yuu ce e laèa.	For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he swore by himself,
Yi yu rara ená nfeè' rlúèshïì ce beèe Nyúè a be lúèshi naè bii ka' ba. Nfeè' anaè be keè ba aèmboè noèñ ce Nyúè aè m geèe li rfaè' a ka' mïìsi wáá a lúshi naè.	There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God.
Gee ne wa'a, yi yu ená Nyúè aè m geèe mñgúè' nyor jáá jáèá jáá vi ce faè' buu jáá jáèá jáá aèmboè e m koèñ.	But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body, just as he desired.
E m laèa neè woweèe ená aètaè a yar blaba', geewa'a, a fa yar bcáè' aè nyoâr bbaa ka'.	but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
Woweèe a ka' duè aèmboè bkïìlomátaè ta duè baè' ntuunfu wa'a, a yá aèmboè Jisoès ce jáèr mbenduè rdip a ce vúè aègee keñ. Woweèe a ka' yá wa'a, a wáp seê.	When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid.
E kwa'shïì a laa neè yïì nyor enáê, ‘M be geèe má ká? M túr dïì' ce m be láè byee ca wááwá ka'.’	He reasoned within himself, saying, 'What will I do, because I don't have room to store my crops?'
Mɛ̀ jàʼ yaa tu.	I have helped myself.
E m ce máè ená m gee tá beèe wááwá a riñ buu ca, ce yu buu ce vi m ba tá ñgoèñ yi ka' keè ba. Nyúè ce e m geèe buu wááwá aè m kupshi buu ca a láê, beèe a riñ vi ka',	and to make all men see what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God, who created all things through Jesus Christ;
Jisoès aè m jáèr aè mú bbu' mla' wááwá aè ñgoâñ Galeèleê, a ce yá'ni beèe aè mndap mloo, a ce feè'shi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ aèmboè kúú Nyúè, a ce geèe beèe ce a m ce yañ byañ jáá jáèá jáá a ce keè'se.	Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
Ñgaâa yá'ni buu Joân a ka' yu' wa'a, a duê, a lor gúèú a tuñ, a du a suñ Jisoès.	His disciples came, and took the body, and buried it; and they went and told Jesus.
Jisoès aè m maè' ku' mñgaèa mo' aèmboè bca, a fe'shi nlaèa Nyúè neè woweèe aè ndeèe ce aède' woweèe a m ba yu'.	With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
Naètanïìyáèl aè laa neè ye enáê, “Waè' aède' yuu boèñboñ yi fúú aè rla' Nasaráèt a?” Felep aè laa neè ye enáê, “Vúè yá.”	"Nathanael said to him, ""Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?"" Philip said to him, ""Come and see."""
Njeñwáè moè' aè m ba aè rla' anaè ce e m ba ñwáâ ñgeèe buu bbebep. E ka' yu' ená Jisoès ce yeñger mbe ndaèp ñwáè Farïìsi ca, a lor mú ntúñ bluèr ce njáèá mgúr mo' ce mi m ce rúèú boèñboñ seê, mi m ba njo,	Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee's house, she brought an alabaster jar of ointment.
Kwaè'shi ka neè aèmboè bkaâañkoè' ce vi ke byeè buu ka', kep buu efa mñkúè ka', túr btaèp káè bcaèñ ka', geewa'a, Nyúè ku ce nyañ woweèe. Yeè ntaa aè luèu seê, a caa yïì bsiñ.	Consider the ravens: they don't sow, they don't reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
Kyese aègee buu ca wááwá, ya ntáèr yu mkwaè'shïì ce m ce kwaè'shi aèmboè bcor wááwá aè mnoèñ wááwá.	Besides those things that are outside, there is that which presses on me daily, anxiety for all the assemblies.
E fa mɛ̀ cɛ̀ʼ, a kaʼ lò embenjìmo a ker koo.	He gave me a cloth and afterwards took it back.
Beèe anaè a koo Jisoès a ba'ni.	They laid their hands on him, and seized him.

a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe aè vúè neè ñwáè ca ená e ce karsi btu ese beèe. Máè fyá' njep múè mo a weâe bsii, a yá máná e geèe yuu mo' efa buu ce weèe aè laèa ená e geèe na ka'. Weèe koni bfúr wee aè ñgá' ce woweèe a ce yá. Weèe ka' gee wa'a, baná weèe aè láè ncir Jisos Kraêis.	Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè mmbañruè ce a túr bbyeèñge ce a yu ñgaâa rbyemïì ka', ker ba bbyeèñge ce a túr bduu ce a yu ñgaâa rbyemïì ka', m be fa woweèe ncep. Ncep ca aè kwaè'shi ba máè, ke' ba ená aè fa Tata Nyúè ka'. Mbañruèñwáè ce e yu ñwáè rbyemïì ka' túr ñgwa ce e yu ñwáè rbyemïì ka', ñgwa yïì anaè ku koñ ená a ye a cu, e fa juèu ye ka'.	But to the rest I--not the Lord--say, if any brother has an unbelieving wife, and she is content to live with him, let him not leave her.

Nduunjì ca zhi yu duŋtè.	This road is uneven.
Weèe aè ka' gee njáèá rfaè' ca, baná weèe ce duèñshi beèe njáèá beèe ce weèe yu. Beèe a be yá, kuè'si Nyúè njobeè' weèe ku ce geèe ba buu ce weèe aè laèa aèmboè Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ kuu Jisos Kraêis.	seeing that through the proof given by this service, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the Good News of Christ, and for the liberality of your contribution to them and to all;
Buu ce a m sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè wááwá, a m sañ tá vi bo cep seèe, geèe tá seèe kur ntee, táá tatap ce keè' ba buu ce Nyúè aè kaè' neè seèe.	For whatever things were written before were written for our learning, that through patience and through encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope.

Tu zhi ce luu ye.	His has got a headache.
Ca yi ce duèñshi ená buu ce Nyúè e ke geèe vi yu yáánïì, njobeè' yi be geèe tá weèe ghááte aè beèe ce a be ye rboèñ embe dïû' kúú Nyúè. A mbuèu ce weèe ce yá ñgá' seè'ni. Yu ya dïì' ená m fe'shi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ neè beèe wááwá; m be feè'shi neè beèe Greêk, ba neè beèe ce a yu beèe Greâk ka', ker ba neè beèe ce a rïìñ ñwaè' ba beèe ce a rïìñ ñwaè' ka'.	I am debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners, both to the wise and to the foolish.
Sarmoèn aè m bi Buwaès ce yïì ma aè m ba Rahaèp, Buwaès aè bi Obáèd ce yïì ma aè m ba Ruêr, Obáèd aè bi Jáásïì.	Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.
Cena yi ka' mïì, Muu Njeèe aè naa nlaèadoñ yïì elúèsimbuèu efa vïû saèamba caè. E ka' naèa, ñgoèñ embe buèu yi noñ ená nyoèñ-ñ-ñ, yuu yi ce kaèra' ka' aè mú nfeè' moè'.	When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
Jisoès aè laa neè woweèe enáê, “M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená be keèe ba aè nfeè' ce a geèe buu wááwá vi kútïì bfi, a nfeè' ce Muu Ñwáè be keèe cu mbe kaèbaèraè' neè yi foèo embe buèu-ñwáè naè, tá weèe ce weèe aè vúè a máâ mbuèu na, cu mbe bkaèbaèraè' ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú, ce sa' mntáè' Isráèl ce ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú. A m duèñshi ryoèñ ca, weèr aè yáê, a ce suñ weèe aèmboè ryoèñ ca ce yu ryoèñ ce nfeseè ce li m ba a Taèr a duñshïì li neè weèr.	(and the life was revealed, and we have seen, and testify, and declare to you the life, the eternal life, which was with the Father, and was revealed to us);
M ker túr ya njeèe mo', yi ba mbe ñka' anaè ka'. M be kuè vúè neè njeèe anaè foñ mbe ñka' ca tá yi yu' yaè njeèndoñ, ba kúr e mo'sir, túr ñwáè rcïìñ moè'sir. Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Divine Nature is like gold, or silver, or stone, engraved by art and design of man.

geewa'a, yuu mo' yi yu ce ñwáè aè ba túr. Máèári aè ce yuu boèñboñ ce a be keèr koo ese ye ka'.”	"but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her."""
“Kúú Nyúè yi yu aèmboè yuu boèñboñ ce a súèti aè mñkúè, ñwáè moè' aè ka' vúè yá, a lor a súti foñ, a lu'shi seê, a duê, a fyeni yïì buu wááwá a yuu ñkúè anaè. “Yáê, m ce vúè seè'ni seè'ni. Mboâñtu mi yu neè beèe ce a ce geèe buu ce a sañ mbe ñwaè' ca.”	Behold, I come quickly. Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' anaè máè be riñ ye ka'. Matthew	Matïìyoè	11	22	M ce suñ weèe máná be keèe ba aè mnoèñ mnsa' tá ñgá' beâe aè rla' Tayaè ba Sidoèn ba yi aèndeèe neè yeè.	But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	11	23	AÈ ka' ba yi aèmboè weèe ce aè rla' Kaèpanuèm, waè' a be ko'si weèe mbe buèu a? Yi yu wa' ka'. Matthew	Matïìyoè	11	29	Loèr neè ya buè', taa ku weâe ndoñ, yá'ni neè buu ese máè njobeè' m yu ñwáâ múnyañ, a ba neè rbornïì-ñwáè, tá weèe bo koni nduunjïì aè rlúèshïì.	Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

Luke	Luêk	13	25	Ka' ba aè nfeè' ce ñwáè ndap aè naèti mbekïì a cete keèñ, a li', tá weèe táá ba njepmbeè ce kuèushi keèñ ce laèa weenáê, ‘Tataê, múè' keèñ neè weèr,’ tá e beesi yi yu enáê, ‘M rïìñ faèdïì' ce weèe ce vúè ka'.’	When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open to us!' then he will answer and tell you, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'

Ñwáè moè' aè m ba, a too ye ená Saimúèn AÈ m ba ñwáè ce e m be ce geèe fii aè rla' Saèmarïìyaè, beâe aè to' anaè a ce báèáñger seê. E m ce geèe fii anaè a ce naèa nyor ená e yu ñwáè ñger. M ce kuushi lo rbyemïì ce wáè byemi neè Jisoès neè yo ntee wááwá. Yoè makú Lowáès, ba yoè ma Yunïìs, a m túr njáèá rbyemïì ca. Ncïìndap Nyúè yïì embenjïì aè fyáp rsoèñ li. E ka' fyáp, a lor yuu mo' ce yi m ce she a feese ma rtuèu, a ma' njep rdip rgoèr.	The second angel sounded, and something like a great burning mountain was thrown into the sea. One third of the sea became blood,
Weèr aè yá ñwáè ca aè ba ñwáè ñgá' seê. E ce teèesi btu ese Jus aè ñgoèñ wááwá, a ba tu mo' neè beèe ce a daè' enjep nduunjïì Nyúè ce a too ená Nasaráên.	For we have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.

Yaa ŋwàʼ ce zhi mʉ bʉ nà zhi yɛti i.	My book which got missing has been seen.
Woweèe a m ce btu embe cor neè bcor wááwá aè mla' anaè, a ce loo ce jïì mdip, ce fa woweèe mbaè mmbo Tata ce woweèe a m byemi neè ye naè.	When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

Máè m sañ yi tá weèe bo rïìñ ená m koèñ weèe seê.	For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not that you should be made sorry, but that you might know the love that I have so abundantly for you.

Weèe be rïìñ yuu mini, tá mini anaè gee tá weèe luêñ.”	"You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free."""
Mghoèo mi suu embe buèu a gweñger aènduè beèe. Rghoâo rmo'sir li m ce rïìr aèmboè baèa msañ wa'a. Ñgá' anaè aè m báámi seê. Beèe a m cáp Nyúè njobeè' ku' ñgá' ce woweèe a m ce yá. Luke	Luêk	15	26	E ká' ñwáè rfaè' moè' a bipshi neè ye ená a ce geèe ba ká lá.	He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.

Luke	Luêk	15	28	Nyor aè bep muu nlee ca, e kanïì aè rniñ mbe ndaèp. Yïì ta aè fúú njepmbeè a boose ye ená e nïîñ.	But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.
Luke	Luêk	15	29	E beesïì a laa neè yïì ta enáê, ‘Yáê, máè faè' neè wáè aèmboè ñkwaèa wa'a aè bfeè' aèñgoo, a be tee-tu neè wáè ka', koo múcaèr. Geewa'a, wáè m be fa máè ka' mú fuâu mbú ená m gee ñkaè' aègho neè bkar wa ka'.	But he answered his father, 'Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.
Luke	Luêk	15	30	Muu woè ca aè koo bti', a ye a bkwaèraè weèe, a ker kúti, wáè koo naè' ce e ruusi a sáá neè ye.’	But when this, your son, came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.'

Baná weèe fa ce nya' mnde' ka'. Ñwáè wááwá laa ba yuu mini neè nfúr yïì njobeè' seèe wááwá yu mñgúè' nyor efa nyor Jisos Kraêis.	Therefore, putting away falsehood, speak truth each one with his neighbor. For we are members of one another.

Seèe rïìñ wa'a njobeè' Nyúè aè m be laa yuu ce e m laèa aèmboè muu yïì neè yïì ncïìndap moè' ka'. Fa túr neè yuu mo' aè rgeèe neè buu bcicïì ce beèe a ce geèe aè túè'nji na ka'. Geèe neè tá buu anaè yááti aèwañ.	Have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather even reprove them.
Yu ba buu ce weèe aè m tuusi ce m ce loèr aè yuu goèr ka'. Yuu ce m ce loèr aè yuu goèr yu ba ku' sá' ce weèe be túr njo' buu anaè.	Not that I seek for the gift, but I seek for the fruit that increases to your account.

ená e gee yuu ce nyor boñ woweèe, laa tá Pol vú aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm. Woweèe a m laèa wa'a njobeè' woweèe a m cu mncúè ená Pol aè ka' ce vúè, baná woweèe a be tá' aè nduunjïì, koo yú.	asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way.
A Pol weèe a seesïì a lá noèñ ce woweèe a be vúè yá ye. Noèñ anaè yi ka' gháá, woweèe a vú seê, a caa aèmboè woweèe a m ba naè, a yá Pol mbe dïì' ce e m ce cu. ba yïì ñwáè, ba yáánïì njobeè' máè byemi neè ye, ke' ba njobeè' máè láè mncir ka'. Nfeè' ce a be sa' mnsa' aè gháá. Beèe ce a be sa' entombïì yu beèe Nyúè. A ka' ká' mnsa' anaè ba neè seèe, yi lo ba eká neè beèe ce a byemi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ ce e loè ese Nyúè naè ka'?	For the time has come for judgment to begin with the household of God. If it begins first with us, what will happen to those who don't obey the Good News of God?
Bfúr waê, weèe fa ce kwaè'shi buu aèmboè weèe yu lá bbonte wa' ka'. Weèe ba aèmboè bbonte ba aè njïì ce weèe be ce kwaè'shi buu bbebep ka'. Kwaè'shi neè buu ba aèmboè bleebeèe.	Brothers, don't be children in thoughts, yet in malice be babies, but in thoughts be mature.
Tata Jisos Kraâis ba Nyúè ce e yu yïìseèe Taê, fa weèe cumúnyañ. Nyúè aè m koèñ seèe a fa seèe ñger nfeseè, a ker ka'ni seèe buu ce seèe aè rïìñ ená vi be ba. E m geèe buu ca njo' yi ntee boèñboñ ce e m túr neè seèe. M ce loo máná Nyúè ca fa weèe cumúnyañ, gee tá weèe táá tatap, ce geèe ba buu bboèñboñ keèr ce laèa ba buu bboèñboñ.	Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace, comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.

Ŋgòŋ zhi yu yuur.	The weather is dry.
Nfeè' aè ka' gháá, Nyúè aè tuu muu yïì njep ñgoèñ na. AÈ m bi njeñwáè a bi muu anaè. A m bi ye aè ñwáè Judaè, e ce láè mncir Juês.	But when the fullness of the time came, God sent out his Son, born to a woman, born under the law,
E m laèa buu ca neè woweèe rara seê. Pitaè aè koo ye, a ye a lá'sïì nyor, a ká' a ce lapni ye kuu yuu ce e laèa anaè.	He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
E ke ba mbe ndaèp ñwáâ ñgoèr, bghee bboèñboñ ba mkïûñ mmboèñmboñ ce a geèe neè bco', ker ba mkïìñ ce a ku boo ba neè mboo mi ku ba mbo. A loè lor bghee ba mkïûñ mmboèñmboñ lá byee njo neè bkeèe, lor mkïìñ ce a ku boo ba neè mboo naè lá byee njo neè ñgaâa ndap.	Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.
Tɛ ŋwɛ̀ kaʼ lòr ŋgwa banɛ e tʉr à rniŋ gùu.	Before a man marries a woman he has to follow all marital procedures.
“Ka' yi m ba wa'a, Nyúè embe buèu e ke cu ba mbe ndap ce a baè'ri neè mmbo ka'. Yi yu aèmboè ñwáè ncep ntuu Nyúè aè m laèa. E m laèa enáê, Tata ce laèa enáê,	However, the Most High doesn't dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says,
A ke zhe mbǎŋ bìrka kaʼ.	We donʼt eat papaw seeds.
Seè'ni ce máè niñ shañ njobeè' Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ na, máè ba koèñ aè rláè ye aèfa tá e lor yo dïì', ce jaè' máè.	whom I desired to keep with me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News.

Beèe magoèr efa múè beèe ce a m byemi, a m vúèse aèwañ, a ce suñ yaèp buu bbebep.	Many also of those who had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.
Baná weèe be rïìñ ená ya nlaèa yi loè ese Jisos Kraêis. Jisoès Kraâis ye ye ghashi weèe neè mmbo ce mi yu mwáèni ka', e ce faè' a weâe mú neè ñger-ñwáè.	seeing that you seek a proof of Christ who speaks in me; who toward you is not weak, but is powerful in you.
E nòŋsi cɛ̀ʼ mbe ntaʼ.	She has laid the cloth on the chair.

AÈ m ba aè nfeè' moè' see seèe aè ba aèmboè beèe ca, a ce geèe buu ce yïìseèe nyor aè m ce koèñ aè rgeèe ker ba vïì ce seèe aè m ce kwaè'shi aè rgeèe. AÈ ka' ba njobeè' seèe aè m ku túr ba njáèá ntee ce beèe ca a m túr, yi ba ená Nyúè be ko'si rshentee neè seèe woweèe wááwá.	among whom we also all once lived in the lust of our flesh, doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest.
Mú nfeè' aè ka' tuuse, e natïì a du aè rla' mo' ce a m ce too ená Náên. Ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu ba ma kúr beèe a du a woweèe.	It happened soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.

Mɛ̀ càni rfàʼ.	I was absent from work.
Jisoès aè laa neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe túr bráâd sá'?” Woweèe a beesïì enáê, “Weèr túr bráâd saèambaê, ba mú nca mo'.”	"Jesus said to them, ""How many loaves do you have?"" They said, ""Seven, and a few small fish."""
Yi yu aèmboè a m sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè enáê, “Ñwáè ce e m kwáè' goèr aè m túr goèr se ka'. Ñwáè ce e m kwáè' múcaèr aè m túr múcaèr se ka'.”	"As it is written, ""He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack."""

E m ku ce noèñ, túè' ce raa, nyúè ce coo. Kwaa ce e m byeè naè aè fúú a ce kuè', e ke' yi aèmboè e geèe a ka' ce kuè' ka'.	and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he doesn't know how.
AÈ ka' ba yi aèmboè yi yú' ce yi yu rara, Tata Nyúè aè fúr Jisoès efa rkwe a yeâ ñger, aè rduèñshi ená e yu muu yïì.	who was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,
“Nyúè aè cete maêp mmir, a teesi wap btu faè dïì' woweèe a bo yá rraa ca neè maêp mmir, rïìñ buu ca, beèesi yap ntee vúè a máâ mbuèu tá m bo geèe woweèe a luñ ka'.”	He has blinded their eyes and he hardened their heart, lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, and would turn, and I would heal them.
A sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè enáê, “Tata aè laèa enáê, ‘AÈmboè m yu nteèe na ñwáè wááwá be keè gú'shi njep máâ tïìi. Ñwáè wááwá be keè laèa neè yi cuèu ená m yu Nyúè.”	"For it is written, ""'As I live,' says the Lord, 'to me every knee will bow. Every tongue will confess to God.'"""
E be vúè njeè múè mcuèñ mor, fa ñgá' neè beèe ce a máñni Nyúè a kani efa rgeèe yuu ce Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ aèmboè Tata Jisoès ce laèa ená a geêe.	giving vengeance to those who don't know God, and to those who don't obey the Good News of our Lord Jesus,
njobeè' e m ce yá'ni ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu, a ce laa neè woweèe enáê, “A be loèr Muu Ñwáè fa mbaè mmbo beèe, tá a yú ye, tá e fúú efa rkwe mbenjïì mnoâñ btaar.”	"For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them, ""The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again."""

Ka' e luèñ efa rkwe enjep roè wa'a, e ku bii nyaèa rkwe.”	"When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said one to another, ""No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped from the sea, yet Justice has not allowed to live."""
Ncïìndap Nyúè aè m ce loâ vúè ce geèe túè anaè yi ce bañti. Túè anaè yi m ce bañti wa'a, ñwáè ce e ka' gwe njo entombïì, e m ka' ce yañ ba njáèá yañ ká, baná e be luèñ.]	for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had.
Cena yi ka' mïì, ncïìndap Nyúè yïì elúèsimbuèu aè fyáp rsoèñ li. E ka' fyáp, máè yu' mnjeèndoñ aèmboè vi suèu embe buèu. Mnjeèndoñ ca vi m laèa mbekïì enáê, “Nfeè' aè gháá ce yïìseèe Nyúè ba Kraâis ce e m tuusi njep ñgoèñ na, a be sa' ñgoèñ ca. Hagaè táá aètu leè' ce a m ye mbe rtuèu Sinaèi ce li yu ba aè ñgoâñ AÈrábïìyaè, a ker táá foñ aètu rla' Jáèrusaláèm lïû seè'ni na, njobeè' beâe aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm wááwá a yu bkwaèa neè mncir. Vúè tá weèe yoè masaè lúshi aèbee.’	His lord said to him, 'Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Zhìi mâ à m̀ so mnsaʼ njobèʼ e m̀ làa ba zhìi làayɛ.	Her mother won the case because she spoke the truth.
Bfúr waê, weèe wááwá ce be'ni ba yuu ce m ce geèe. Weèr aè duèñshi ndeâe mboèñmboñ. Weèe be'ni yuu ce beèe ce a beè'ni yeèr ndeèe anaè, a ce geèe.	Brothers, be imitators together of me, and note those who walk this way, even as you have us for an example.
M ce koèñ máná weèe kuushi buu ce ñgaâa ncep ntuu Nyúè ce a m ba beâe brara a m ce laèa, ker ba yuu ce Tata Jisoès ce e geèe seèe aè luñ aè m laèa ená weèe geêe. E m tuu yi ñgaâa ntuu a vú a suñ weèe buu anaè.	that you should remember the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and the commandments of us, the apostles of the Lord and Savior:

neè yaè beèe ce a yu bfúr wa seeseê, weèr woweèe aè ba láá e mo'sir. M ce koèñ máná ndoèo co' máè, tá weèr Jisos Kraâis gapni, ce yi ka' ba ená ñgaèpni anaè yi be jaè' yaè beèe.	For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers' sake, my relatives according to the flesh,

A ye e nyɛɛ encàŋ nà.	There he is coming from afar.

E ka' yu' wa'a, nyor aè bep ye seê, njobeè' e m túr ku' buu seê.	But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' anaè Jisoès aè laa enáê, “Taèr, Tata ce aè túr rbuu ba nshe, m ce yoèñshi wáè njobeè' wáè súèti buu ca ese ñgaâa bfee ba beèe ce a rïìñ buu, a duñshi ba neè boo bká'. A niŋ à kòp a roo ŋguu a yɛ kaʼ.	They entered in the forest, looked for firewood and did not see any.
E bàŋsi mŋgòmbe.	She has stored banana so that they can get ripe.
Ñwáè aè ka' ce geèe ba buu ce yïì nyor koèñ, baná ñgaèñ be koni rbep ba rkwe. Ñwáè ce e ka' ce geèe ba buu ce Yú' Nyúè yi koèñ, baná ñgaèñ be koni ryoèñ ce nfeseè.	For he who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption. But he who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
Weèe ce kwaè'shi ená beèe ca a no mruè' mi koo woweèe. Yi yu wa' ka'. Seè'ni ku bii nyúè búè'ú aè ñgaèptú'.	For these aren't drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.
AÈ ka' ba yi aèmboè beèe Isráèl, AÈsayaè aè m laèa yuu a kuu woweèe. Bfúr waê, m ce koèñ tá weèe riñ ená ñgá' ce e koni máè na aè geèe Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ aè misïì a du kuèntombïì.	Now I desire to have you know, brothers, that the things which happened to me have turned out rather to the progress of the Good News;
Máè yá ncïìndap Nyúè ce e m túr ñger magoèr seê. E m waa, a laa enáê, “Ñwáè ce e ghááte aè rnaèa nlaèadoñ ce a sïìñ bcuèu fuè ñwaè' aègho naè, búèr ñwaè' anaè yu nda?”	"I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, ""Who is worthy to open the book, and to break its seals?"""
Ncïìndap Nyúè ce e m tár yi kuèu mbenduè rdip rgoèr, a tár mo' mbenduè nshe naè aè naa yi bo maè' mbe buèu.	The angel who I saw standing on the sea and on the land lifted up his right hand to the sky,
E ka' túr yuu ce e la' rkaa anaè aègho ka', yïì masaè aè laa ená a koo ye ba ñgwa yïì ba boo vi, ker lor yïì buu wááwá, fyeni la' li rkaa aègho.	But because he couldn't pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
Nyúè aè m loèr buu wááwá a lá njeptii Jisoès, a ker gee ená e ba tu neè coêr, ce sa' buu wááwá.	He put all things in subjection under his feet, and gave him to be head over all things for the assembly,
Ma yïì Jisoès ker ba bfúr vi a m vúè aè ryá ye, nduunjïì yi ke' ba neè woweèe aè ryá ye ka' njobeè' beèe a m ba goèr seê.	His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.
M ce ko'ndoñ neè weèe neè njáèá ñko'ndoñ ce Nyúè túr. Weèe yu aèmboè muunje ce e be riñ mbañruèñwáè ka', máè kanïì máná m be guèusi ye neè mbañruèñwáè moè'sir caè'caè'. Mbañruèñwáè ca yu Jisos Kraêis.	For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I married you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
E kanïì aè bsii beèe wááwá, a laa enáê, “M rïìñ yuu ce aè ce laèa ka'.”	"But he denied it before them all, saying, ""I don't know what you are talking about."""
Woweèe a kútïì a suñ bár beèe, woweèe a ker byemi ka'.	They went away and told it to the rest. They didn't believe them, either.
Hároèd ba vi bsoogáè a m vúèshi ye, a lor ye aè yuu cicïì, a lor cáâ' boèñboñ a ma' ye aè nyoèr, a kúsi ye neè Pailáèt.	Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.
Awá Jus a ká' a ce sár mnsár a waâp mú tatap seê, a ce laèa enáê, “AÈde' ñwáè fa yïì nyor neè seèe ená seèe ye aè njáâá ká?”	"The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, ""How can this man give us his flesh to eat?"""
Ñgúè buu moè' aè m gweèñger aè múè msini, msini mi ku', a kur.	Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.
Cu neè rcu rboèñboñ aè múè beèe ce a rïìñ Nyúè ka' tá woweèe a ka' ba ce laèa ená weèe yu ñgaâa ñgeèe buu bbebep áè, tá a bo yá buu bboèñboñ ce weèe ce geèe, kuè'si Nyúè aè noèñ ce e be vúè aè rsa' ñgoèñ.	having good behavior among the nations, so in that of which they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they see, glorify God in the day of visitation.
Ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir ba beèe Farïìsi a ká' a ce laèa enjep ntee enáê, “Ñwáè ce e ce bepsi rlii Nyúè na a nda? Ñwáè ce aède' e foosïì ñwáè efa buu bbebep caa efa Nyúè yu nda?”	"The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, ""Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?"""
Nyo anaè aè fúr mdip ekuè cuèu, mi ba aèmboè rdip wa'a. E m fúr mdip anaè tá mi bo loèr njeñwáè anaè duè aègho.	The serpent spewed water out of his mouth after the woman like a river, that he might cause her to be carried away by the stream.
Jisoès aè laa neè woweèe ená a fa suñ ñwáè moè' ka'. A ker laa neè woweèe ená a fa muu anaè byee tá e ye.	He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè muu, Nyúè aè laa enáê, “Wáâ Nyúè, yo kúú yi be cu nfeseè. AÈ be sa' yo to' neè mini-ñwáè.	"But of the Son he says, ""Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your Kingdom."
Koèniyuès aè laa enáê, “Mnoèñ vi caèa seè'ni kyeèe ce máè mú ba mbe máâ ndaèp, aè nfeâ' seè'ni ce yu nyúè taar neèmootïì na, a ce loo. Ñwáè moè' aè ku lo a táá kuèntombïì neè máè, a yar bcáè' ce vi m ce raa seê,	"Cornelius said, ""Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,"
Woweèe a m ce yoèp yáá ce Musïìs ce e m ce faè' neè Nyúè aè m yoèp, aè ba yáá Muu Njeèe foñ naè. Woweèe a m yoèp enáê, “Wáâ Nyúè ce aè yu yeèr taê, ñger wááwá yi yu mba wáâ mmboè. Mo mfaè' mi caèa ñger, aè ba foñ mfaâ' mmbáèá. AÈ yu ñkúú neè bto' wááwá enjep ñgoèñ na, buu ce wáâ geèe vi ku ba yáánïì, a ba mini aè nfeè' wááwá.	"They sang the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, ""Great and marvelous are your works, Lord God, the Almighty! Righteous and true are your ways, you King of the nations."

Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over those whose sins weren't like Adam's disobedience, who is a foreshadowing of him who was to come.
Máâ laèa ca seè'ni ba neè bkúè ker ba byepkúú. Yi yu boèñboñ ená woweèe a ku cu neè yap tu aèmboè má máè cu na.	But I say to the unmarried and to widows, it is good for them if they remain even as I am.
A weèr ce weèr ce suñ beèe buu ca, Yú' Rara ce Nyúè aè fa neè beèe ce a ce yu'ni neè ye, yi ce suñ woweèe foñ.”	"We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him."""

a laa enáê, “Masaè, weèr ce kuushi ená aè m ba aè nfeè' ce ñwáè mbo' beèe ca aè m bii nteèe, e m laèa enáê, ‘Mnoèñ vi be caâa btaar, tá m fúú efa rkwe.’	"saying, ""Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: 'After three days I will rise again.'"

Ñkúú efa múè beâe bbebep ca yu máè.	The saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.
tá Jisos Kraâis cu njep weâe mntee aèmboè weèe aè byemi neè ye na. M ce loo máná weèe taa mñgaèñ, táá tatap aè rkoèñnïì,	that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; to the end that you, being rooted and grounded in love,

Yuu ce weèr ce loo neè Nyúè yi yu ená weèe fa geèe yuu bebep ka'. Weèr ce loo wa'a, a ke' ce loo tá beèe a bo yá ená weèr aè so ka'. Weèr ce loo ba ená weèe gee yuu ce yi yu yáánïì, ka' yi ce yááti aèmboè weèr aè lá gweè wa'a.	Now I pray to God that you do no evil; not that we may appear approved, but that you may do that which is honorable, though we are as reprobate.
Mboè weèe rïìñ ená weèe aè ka' fa weêe mnyor neè ñwáè tá weèe bo ce yu'ni neè ñgaèñ aèmboè bkwaèa wa'a, baná weèe yu bkwaèa neè ñwáè ce weèe ce yu'ni neè ye anaè a? Weèe aè ka' fa weêe mnyor aè rgeèe buu bbebep, weèe ba bkwaèa neè buu bbebep, sá' efa gho aè ba rkwe. Bár ñgaâa yá'ni buu Jisoès a m vúè yap ba mbe keñ. A ka' ce vúè wa'a, a ce súèñ rraa ce nca yi m ba njo goèr se naè, a ce vúè aègho. But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.
Yi ka' ba wa'a, e nashïì buu moè' mbe ndaèp rloo neè Jus ba neè Greâk ce a m ce loo neè Nyúè. E m geèe wa' foñ aè mnoèñ wááwá aè ntaa neè beèe ce a m vúè aèfo.	So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with those who met him.
Jisoès aè m rïìñ ená woweèe a koèñ aè rbipshi yuu neè ye, a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Máè laèa enáê, ‘Nfeè' múcaèr tá weèe yá máè ka', e keèr ba nfeè' múcaèr tá weèe yá máè.’ Waè' a yuu ce weèe ce bipshi a weâe mú a?	"Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, ""Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, 'A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?'"
E m ká' btu mo' a baa ce a m ce faè' njep yeâ tïìi, a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Loèr neè bsoogáè mjeâe mmbaa, ba ñgaâa mnyaèabaèraè' msaèambaê, ba ñgaâa mkoèñ mjeâe mmbaa tá weèe woweèe lo neètú' na aè nyúè búè'úê, duè aè rla' Sisaèriyaè. E kòŋ kʉʉ sê.	He likes chieftaincy too much.

Beèe wááwá ce a duè entombïì neè máè, a yu byáèá, njeèe yi máñnïì yaèp njeèndoñ.	All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn't listen to them.
