AÈ ka' ba aè mbuèuñkuèr anaè, beèe mo' a vú neè ñgaèa byañ ba beèe ce byú' mnyúâmkaè' vi m niñ njep woweèe, a vú aègho aè ryá Jisoès.	At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.
Agripaè aè laa neè Fástoès enáê, “M be koèñ foñ aè ryu' yuu ce ñwáè anaè be laèa.” Fástoès aè beesïì enáê, “AÈ be yu' yuu ce e be laèa ba aèyaèñseè.”	"Agrippa said to Festus, ""I also would like to hear the man myself."" ""Tomorrow,"" he said, ""you shall hear him."""
M ka' yá máná m be ye njáèá byee anaè tá nfúraè gee yuu bebep, gweè, baná m be keèr ye vi ka'.	Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will eat no meat forevermore, that I don't cause my brother to stumble.
Njeñwáè anaè aè m rïìñ yuu ce yi m koni ye, a ká' a wáp, a ce kaèñ, a vú a gwe njeptii Jisoès, a suñ yïì mini.	But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
Ñwáè ca aè ka' yu' yuu ce Jisoès aè laèa, a sá seê, a kar bsii a duê, njobeè' e m túr ku' buu seê.	But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.
Ñwaè' ca ce sañ máâ Jáêms, ce m yu ñwáè rfaè' neè Nyúè ker ba neè Tata Jisos Kraêis. M ce sañ neè weèe ce beèe Isráèl ce aè mntáè' ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú ce a da'se mbe tunshe sïìp. M ce ca'ni weèe.	James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.
M ce yoèñshi Nyúè aè nfeè' wááwá njo' weèe, a ker ce loo neè weèe aè nfeè' ce m ka' ce loo.	don't cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers,
Njàp ca à rʉ̀ʼte bòŋboŋ sê.	This soup is very delicious.
Woweèe a m kani efa kupse yap ntee, borni yaèp buu bbebep. Woweèe a m ku ce yúshi beèe, a ce geèe tú', a ce saèki, a ce yáèá.	They didn't repent of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their sexual immorality, nor of their thefts.
Máè ka' duè aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm, beâe bgoèrgoèr efa múè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì ba bleebeèe efa múè Jus a suñ buu ce e geèe, a laa ená m laa máná e gweè mnsa'.	about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for a sentence against him.
E m kwe, a tuñ ye, mnoèñ vi ka' baâ' btaar, e fúú efa rkwe aèmboè a m sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè.	that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,
Beèe a yá'ni mnyaèa ce aè rïìñ ba vïì enjep roè, ba bsiñ, vi ce geèe aèmboè beèe a koèñ;	For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and thing in the sea, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind.
Jisoès aè ka' laèa wa'a, ñwáè rkeè'ni Ndap Nyúè moè' ce e m táá a yeâ geñ aè lip ye neè bo a laa neè ye enáê, “Haba! Waè' a njáèá njïì ce aède' aè beesïì yuu neè ñwáè ce e yu tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì a?”	"When he had said this, one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand, saying, ""Do you answer the high priest like that?"""
E ka' geèe wa'a, a kúti mbe dïì' ce e ba ba, a bá' bráâd a ye, a de' a woweèe, caar túè' aè raêa. Túè' aè ka' raa, e ma'shïì woweèe a duê.	When he had gone up, and had broken bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even until break of day, he departed.
Baná weèe fa maè'shi tá yuu bebep yi túr ñger mbenduè wee mnyor ce vi be kweñger, tá weèe ce geèe buu bbebep ce weèe ce koèñ na ka'.	Therefore don't let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts.
Woweèe a m ker túr cuèu aè rbipshi yuu mo' neè ye ka'.	They didn't dare to ask him any more questions.
E ka' mïìsi, a kúti a yá ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe ku bii ce buumi, a ce lúèshi a? Yáê, nfeè' aè gháá. A be fa Muu Ñwáè mbe mmbo ñgaâa ñgeèe buu bbebep.	"Then he came to his disciples, and said to them, ""Sleep on now, and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners."
a laa enáê, “Fa neè máè njáèá ñger ca foñ, má máâ láè mmbo mbenduè ñwáè, ñgaèñ bo koni Yú' Rara.”	"saying, ""Give me also this power, that whoever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit."""
Ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu ce ncoèp-moè'sir-aè-rrúèú, a du aè ñgoâñ Galeèleê, a du a ko' mbe rtuèu ce Jisoès aè m laèa ená woweèe a ko' mbo naè.	But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.
Yi ka' ba wa'a, bfúr a lor Pol njaè' moè'sir a du aègho aèwaâa rdip rgoèr, Silaès ba Timotïì a cu yap aè rla' Báèriyaè.	Then the brothers immediately sent out Paul to go as far as to the sea, and Silas and Timothy still stayed there.
Beèe ce a yu Jus ka', a riñ mncir ka', a ka' ce geèe buu mo' ce mncir vi ce laèa aè mkwaè'shïì map, ka' woweèe a rïìñ mncir ka' wa'a, woweèe a ku riñ yuu ce yi yu yáánïì.	(for when Gentiles who don't have the law do by nature the things of the law, these, not having the law, are a law to themselves,
Ñwáè wááwá gee yuu ce aède' yi ja' ñwáè moè'. Ñwáè fa geèe ba yuu ce yi ku boèñ ba ye caè'caè' ka'.	Let no one seek his own, but each one his neighbor's good.
Baná beèe ce a ce yá ñgá' aèmboè Nyúè aè koèñ, a ba fa waêp mnyor neè ñwáè ce e m boo woweèe, ce e yu ñwáè mini, kuè ce geèe buu bboèñboñ.	Therefore let them also who suffer according to the will of God in doing good entrust their souls to him, as to a faithful Creator.
AÈ ka' ba neètú' moè', e du a yá Jisoès, a laa neè ye enáê, “Rabaèi, weèr rïìñ werná a wáè ñwáè ryá'nïì ce Nyúè aè tuu, njobeè' Nyúè aè ka' tá fa ñwáè ñger ka', aède' ñgaèñ duñshïì mncoèo ce aè ce duèñshi na ka'.”	"The same came to him by night, and said to him, ""Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him."""
E ka' laèa wa'a, Pitaè aè bipshi neè ye enáê, “Tataê, nfúraè aè ka' ce geèe buu bbebep neè máè, m foosïì bkaâñ sá'? AÈde' m foosïì ye caar ba' ñkaèraè' saèamba a?”	"Then Peter came and said to him, ""Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?"""
AÈ m ba entombïì wer weèr foñ aè ba blúr, a tee btu. Weèr aè m daè' nduunjïì. Weèr aè m ba bkwaèa neè buu wááwá ce yeèr nyor aè m koèñ. Mer mkwaè'shïì mi m ba mmbembep, weèr aè ce ko'ndoñ neè beèe, beèe a mmbaa weèr, weèr aè baa woweèe foñ.	For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
AÈmboè seèe aè byemi ená Jisoès aè m kwe a fúú efa rkwe, seèe aè byemi foñ ená e ba aè nfeè' ce e vúè, tá Nyúè fúr beèe wááwá ce a m byemi neè Jisoès naè efa rkwe, aèmboè e fúr Jisoès efa rkwe naè.	For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep in Jesus.
Beèe ca a ce rúè'ñger aè nfeè' wááwá. Yuu mo' yi ghááte woweèe ka'. Woweèe a geèe yuu ce yaèp nyor koèñ. Woweèe a ce laèa nlaèa naèa-nyor, a ce bu' cuèu tá a bo bo' beèe, koni yuu mo' enjo.	These are murmurers and complainers, walking after their lusts (and their mouth speaks proud things), showing respect of persons to gain advantage.
Jisoès aè laa neè Jus ce a m byemi neè ye naè enáê, “Weèe ka' ku ce geèe buu ce máè yá'ni weèe, baná weèe yu ñgaâa yá'ni yaè buu ghup.	"Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, ""If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples."
Ŋkar yàa à gòo nè yaŋ bfěʼ bbaa.	My friend has suffered with a sickness for two years.
Coni mgʉr enjep botòr tɛ m̀ du yuu mmoʼ njo.	Drain oil from the bottle so that I should go and buy more in it.
E beesïì a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Wee ke yá aèmboè rbuu li baèñ aè mbuèuñkuèr, weèe laa weená ñgoèñ yi be fúú boèñ,	"But he answered them, ""When it is evening, you say, 'It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.'"
Wɛ̀ làa enɛ rjɛ̀r rli kʉ̀ni lɛ?	Did you say that the journey has failed to take place?
Baná a be lip ye, tá m ma'shi tá e duê.”	"I will therefore chastise him and release him."""
E ká' ye a laa neè ye enáê, ‘Yuu ce máè yu' a kuu wáè naè yu ba ká? Beè' yaè buu wááwá, sañ tá m bo rïìñ aèmboè vi yu, njobeè' aè be keèr ba yaè ñwáè rfaè' ka'.’	He called him, and said to him, 'What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.'
E yu mʉnyaŋ sê.	He is very slow.
Máè suñ weèe buu ca seè'ni tá vi ka' koni, vi ka' lo koni tá weèe bo byemi ená m yu njáèá ñwáè ce m yu.	From now on, I tell you before it happens, that when it happens, you may believe that I am he.
Ka' yi yu wa'a, aè m ba aè nfeè' ce boo anaè a m ku bii njep rbúè, a ke' be geèe yuu bbebep káè yuu boèñboñ ka', Nyúè aè laa neè Ráèbákaè enáê, “Nlee be faè' neè Ñká'.” Nyúè aè m geèe wa' tá yi bo ba ená aè ce ba ye a ce moè' efa boo ca aèmboè e m kwaè'shi, aè ke' ba ba njobeè' yuu mo' ce ñwáè anaè aè m geèe ka', aè m ba njobeè' aè m káè' ba Nyúè.	"For being not yet born, neither having done anything good or bad, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him who calls, it was said to her, ""The elder will serve the younger."""
Rkwe muu anà rli bepsi cùu sê.	That childʼs death is very tragic.
Yuu mo' yi yu efa buu ce Nyúè aè m geèe ce aède' Nyúè buu efa ryá ka'. Buu wááwá vi yu aèwañ aè bsii Nyúè ce e yu ñwáè ce seèe be keè táá kuèntombïì neè ye aè noèñ mo', suñ buu wááwá ce seèe aè m geèe.	There is no creature that is hidden from his sight, but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
Zhii nfee zhi ce yaŋ ye.	His leg is paining.
Ñwáè nsa' mnsa' ca aè ku ce kani. A ka' loè a laa neè yïì nyor enáê, ‘Ka' m ce wáp Nyúè ka', a ce loèr beèe aè yuu ka' wa'a,	He wouldn't for a while, but afterward he said to himself, 'Though I neither fear God, nor respect man,
Weèr aè ka' vúè yá weèe, a ce feè'shi aènji káè neè ntee sii ka', a ce bo' ñwáè moè' ka'.	For our exhortation is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deception.
Bkúú enjep ñgoèñ na ce a m ce ká' rla' ca ená a woweèe a sakïî, ce ye ñgoèñ naè, a be yá nje efa mor ce yi be toèo rla' ca, taa mmbo mbe tuè, war.	The kings of the earth, who committed sexual immorality and lived wantonly with her, will weep and wail over her, when they look at the smoke of her burning,
Pailáèt aè beesïì enáê, “M yu ñwáè Jus ka'. Beèe ce a vúè neè wáè a fa neè máè yu yoè beèe ker ba beèe efa waâp mú ce a ke tañshi tañshïì naè. Wáè geèe ba ká a ka' koo wáè a vú aègho?”	"Pilate answered, ""I'm not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?"""
Ca yi be geèe tá weèe koni fáñ aè rsuñ woweèe buu kuu máè.	It will turn out as a testimony for you.
Yàa tâa à byè mtɛɛ.	My father has planted palm trees.
Woweèe a seesïì, a lor mbaèa anaè, a du a yuu ñkúè ñwáè mboo mkïìñ aègho tá a bo ce tuñ bkïìloè aèfo.	They took counsel, and bought the potter's field with them, to bury strangers in.
ená m ba ñwáè rfaè' Jisos Kraâis neè beèe enje jáá. M ce geèe rfaè' ca wa'a, a ba aèmboè ñwáè tañshi tañshïì wa'a. M ce feè'shi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ ce e loè ese Nyúè tá beèe enje jáá a bo ba aèmboè yuu m ce tañshi tañshïì aègho ce yi yu yáánïì aè bsii Nyúè njobeè' Yú' Rara yi geèe yi ba rara.	that I should be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, serving as a priest the Good News of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be made acceptable, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
E beesïì enáê, “Buu ce aède' beèe a riñ kuu kúú Nyúè ka' na, Nyúè aè geèe weèe aè rïîñ. AÈ ka' ba yi aèmboè woweèe, Nyúè aè geèe woweèe a riñ ka'.	"He answered them, ""To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them."
a laa enáê, “Wáè ka' ba ñkúú Juês, aè ja' ka yo tu efa ñgá'.”	"and saying, ""If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!"""
Caè'ni neè ñgaâa rbyemïì ce a ke niñ cor mbe waâp ndaèp. Caè'ni neè ÁÈpáènitoès ce e yu ñkaraè ce wa mntee naè. E m ba ñwáè entombïì aè rbyemi neè Kraâis aè ñgoâñ Áshaè.	Greet the assembly that is in their house. Greet Epaenetus, my beloved, who is the first fruits of Achaia to Christ.
Weèe aè ka' gee buu ce máè laèa neè weèe, weèe be cu njep la rkoèñnïì aèmboè má máè foñ aè geèe buu ce yaè Ta aè laèa ená m geêe, a cu njep li rkoèñnïì naè.	If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and remain in his love.
Sò à ba dû àbee, wɛ̀ du a jeʼsi mɛ̀ njokɛ?	We went together, and why did you confuse me?
Maamaê, m ce loo weèe seè'ni ená seèe koñni. M ce sañ wa'a a ce laèa ba yuu fi neè wáè ka', yu ba yi ce seèe a m yu' efa rkáè'.	Now I beg you, dear lady, not as though I wrote to you a new commandment, but that which we had from the beginning, that we love one another.
E tʉr ntàʼtè.	He has a job.
Ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu a m rïìñ yuu mo' efa buu ce e m laèa anaè ka'. A m súèti mbuèu efa yuu ce e m laèa anaè ese woweèe, woweèe a ke' riñ yuu ce e m ce laèa anaè ka'.	They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn't understand the things that were said.
Ntaaŋguu ca à waŋger.	This stick has cracked.
M be loo neè Taèr tá e tuusi weèe Ñwáè Rjaè' moè' tá e bo cu weèe woweèe nfeseè.	I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor, that he may be with you forever,--
Yi be keè ba wa'a njobeè' ñgaâa nya' mnde' ce a yu ñgaâa mbo'ni a be keè yá'ni njáèá ryá'nïì ca. Woweèe a be keè rïìñ jáá jáèá jáá efa yuu boèñboñ ba yuu bebep ka' njobeè' wap mntee vi yini.	through the hypocrisy of men who speak lies, branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron;
Ñwáè efa weâe mú ce mluè mi ka' ce koo ye, e kyeseè noèñ mo' mbenduè vi mnoèñ enjep ñgoèñ na a nda?	"Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	28	Mluè mi ce koo weèe aèmboè bcáâ' byar njoká? Kwaè'shi ka neè aèmboè bfúèlawaâ aè rïìñ vi ke kuè'. Vi ke faè' ka', ce ba' bcáè' ka'.	Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don't toil, neither do they spin,
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	29	Ka' yi yu wa'a, m ce suñ weèe máná ka' bcáè' kúú ce Solomúèn aè m ce yar ce vi m boèñ se naè, mo' yi m boèñ aèmboè fúèlawaè ka'.	yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	30	Nyúè ka' ce suèsi mjáá efa rïìñ ce mi ke yááti ntïìni, e fúú aèyaèñseè, a too njep mor, baná e be suèsi yi weèe goèr aèmboè ká? Le rbyemïì li yu múcaèr.	But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won't he much more clothe you, you of little faith?
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	31	Baná mluè mi fa ce koo weèe tá weèe ce laèa weenáê, ‘Weèr be ye ba ká?’ káè enáê, ‘Weèr be no ba ká?’, káè ená ‘Weèr be yar ba ká?’ ka'.	Therefore don't be anxious, saying, 'What will we eat?', 'What will we drink?' or, 'With what will we be clothed?'"
Jisoès aè laa yuu ka'. Ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì aè laa neè ye enáê, “M ce laèa neè wáè ená aè kaa aè rlii Nyúè ce e yu nteèe, suñ ka weèr ená aè yu Kraâis anaè, ce e yu Muu Nyúè naè láê.”	"But Jesus held his peace. The high priest answered him, ""I adjure you by the living God, that you tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God."""
E làa enɛ e be lɛ dù.	He said that he would go.
baná rshentee Nyúè li be gweè mbe tu ñwáè anaè. Rshentee Nyúè anaè li be ba aèmboè mruâ' mtatap ce a fiñshi ka'. E be no mi wááwá. E be yá mluè njep mor ce yi ce she aèmboè a láè lá mkaèñ njo wa'a. E be yá ñgá' ca aè bsii bcïìndap Nyúè ba Muu Njeèe.	he also will drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared unmixed in the cup of his anger. He will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb.
Túè' e raa, beèe wááwá a du mbe Ndaèp Nyúè aè mú ñgaèptú' tá a bo yu' buu ce e ce yá'ni.	All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.
Woweèe a ce suñ beèe ená yuu mo' yi be ker kur woweèe ka'. Ka' woweèe a ce suñ beèe wa'a, woweèe a ku bii faè' bkwaèa neè buu bbebep, njobeè' yuu ce yi ka' túr ñger mbenduè ñwáè, baná ñgaèñ yu ñkwaèa neè yuu anaè.	promising them liberty, while they themselves are bondservants of corruption; for a man is brought into bondage by whoever overcomes him.
Beèe a be loè tee yaèp mbuèu tá woweèe a yááti aèwañ aèmboè Jánïìs ba Jámbráès a m yááti naè.	But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be.
Nyor buu embe buèu yu jáá efa nyor buu enjep ñgoèñ. Rboèñ buu embe buèu li yu jáá efa rboèñ buu enjep ñgoèñ.	There are also celestial bodies, and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial.
E ká' mú ghaèrñwáè, a tár mbe waâp mú,	Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the midst of them,
Wɛ̀ làa, mɛ̀ yuʼ bòŋboŋ kaʼ, banɛ à raasi mɛ̀.	When you spoke I did not understand, so explain it to me.
Yàa tâ à bɛʼ nè mɛ̀ njoʼ mɛ̀ lèse ŋwàʼ.	My father scolded at me because I forget a book.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè aè nyúè taar wa'a, Jisoès aè waa, a laa enáê, “ÁÈloêi, ÁÈloêi, Lama Saèbaètanïì?” ce mbuèu efa gho yu enáê, “Yaè Nyúè, Yaè Nyúè, wáè leèse máè njoká?”	"About the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, ""Eli, Eli, lima sabachthani?"" That is, ""My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"""
Seèe wááwá aè koni bfee jáá jáèá jáá ese Nyúè njo' yi ntee boèñboñ ce e túr neè seèe, a ce geèe mfaè' aègho. Baná ñwáè wááwá geèe rfaè' neè bfee anaè. Nyúè aè ka' fa ñwáè bfee ce aède' e cep ntuu Nyúè, baná ñwáè anaè cep aèmboè li rbyemïì li yu.	Having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us, if prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of our faith;
Tá a ka' ye Ñkaâ' caèasi-mndap, Jisoès aè m rïìñ ená nfeè' aè gháá ce e be maè'shi ñgoèñ ca duè yá yïì Taê. E m koèñ yïì beèe ce a yu njep ñgoèñ na, a koñ woweèe a du a misïî.	Now before the feast of the Passover, Jesus, knowing that his time had come that he would depart from this world to the Father, having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
Nfò à rɛɛ muu nè ngor mbe tu.	Nfor has hit the child with a tightened fist on the head.
Beèe a ka' vúè, a lor cáâ' beer a fa ye aè nyoèr, a gee rtaa kúú neè bsoèpsïì a sop ye mbe tuè,	They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
Beèe ca a m kweñger a lá rlii mbenjïì njobeè' woweèe a m byemi neè Nyúè. Ka' yi m ba wa'a, woweèe a m koni yuu ce Nyúè aè m kaè' ená e be loè fa neè beèe ka'.	These all, having had testimony given to them through their faith, didn't receive the promise,
M ce roèo ba ená beèe a ku'si máè ka'. Ñwáè moè' yu ce e ce roèo ená beèe a ku'si ye, a ba ñwáè sa' mnsa'.	But I don't seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.
Nleeŋwɛ̀ e ke buu à laʼ bghàrbèe âfo a ku mɛŋni ndèetoʼ.	When there is no elder in a compound, the children of that compound lack cultural knowledge.
“Weèr aè m yu' aèmboè e ce laèa enáê, ‘M be saè'si Ndap Nyúè ce beèe a baè'ri neè mmbo na, loèr mnoâñ btaar baè'ri njáèá moè' ce aède' ñwáè ba'rïì ka'.” ’	We heard him say, 'I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.'
Seèe ce liseèe rbyemïì li tap, seèe aè ba kur ntee neè beèe ce lap rbyemïì li yu wáèni. Seèe fa geèe ba buu ce nyor boñ ba seèe ka'.	Now we who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
E gèe ŋgèe nfùŋrì sê.	He behaves very foolishly.
Jisoès aè ka' naèa mmir fyá' ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu, a laa enáê, “Mboâñtu mi yu neè weèe ce weèe yu ñgaâa fuèp, njobeè' kúú Nyúè yu ye.	"He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, ""Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God."
Woweèe a ka' ce duè, beèe mo' efa múè beèe ce a m ce keè'ni rsheè a du aè múè rla', a suñ beâe bgoèrgoèr efa múè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì yuu ce yi koni.	Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city, and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.
Weèe yu ñgúè' moè' efa ndaèp Nyúè ce a boo. Beèe ce a m ba ñgaâa ntuu neè Jisos Kraêis, ba ñgaâa ncep ntuu Nyúè, a ba kuèundap anaè. Jisos Kraâis yu luèr rbuu ndap anaè,	being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone;
Tá ñwáè ka' ye bráâd ca, keèr no enjep ndoñ ca, ñgaèñ fyá' yïì nyor boèñboñ ka' gee wa'a.	But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.
AÈ ka' ba yi aèmboè beèe embe Jáèrusaláèm ce embe buèu, woweèe a yu bkwaèa ka'. Jáèrusaláèm ca yu yïìseèe maê.	But the Jerusalem that is above is free, which is the mother of us all.
E ka' yá, a bááñger seê. E ka' ce ko'shi aètútú aè rfyá', a yu' aèmboè Tata aè laèa enáê,	When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him,
Ñwáè aè ka' no mdip ce aè fa máè a fa ye, aède' ntee mdip yi ker luu ye aè nfeè' moè' ka'. Mdip ce m be fa ñgaèñ mi be ba neè ye aèmboè rdip ce li be ce fúú aè nfeè' wááwá, geèe tá e koni ryoèñ ce nfeseè.”	"but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life."""
Rmoèoshïì ca li be vúè neè weèe tá le rbyemïì li bo ba yáánïì. Ka' gul ce e ke cu nfeseè ka' naè, beèe a ke loèr too njep mor tá e bo ba yáánïì. A mboè le rbyemïì ce li luèu ntaa a caa gul naè li ku ba wa'a. A be moèoshi li tá li bo ba yáánïì, tá a bo yoèñshi weèe, kuè'si weèe, yu'ni neè weèe nyúè ce Jisos Kraâis be yááti aèwañ.	that the proof of your faith, which is more precious than gold that perishes even though it is tested by fire, may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ--
Beèe ce a feèp a ce yá buu, mntáèñ a ce jáèshi yáánïì, ñgaâa msaèasïì a ce keè'se, ce ba brara, mnfuñtuè' a ce yu' buu, beèe ce a kweñger a ce kúti bteèe, ñgaâa fuèp a ce suñ Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ.	the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
Weèe aè ka' niñ mbe ndaèp, weèe ca'nïì beèe embo.	As you enter into the household, greet it.
Moè' efa beâe bgoèrgoèr ca aè bipshïì neè máè enáê, “Wáè rïìñ njáèá beèe ce a yar bcáâ' bbúú na a? Woweèe a vúè efá?”	"One of the elders answered, saying to me, ""These who are arrayed in white robes, who are they, and from where did they come?"""
M túr buu goèr ce m ba sañ neè weèe. M be keèr sañ sañ ka', m ce kwaè'shi máná m be vúè yá weèe, laèa neè ya cuèu tá seèe bo lu'shi duè mïìsi.	Having many things to write to you, I don't want to do so with paper and ink, but I hope to come to you, and to speak face to face, that our joy may be made full.
A m boo ñka' anaè neè bluèr ce vi m ce raañger aèmboè kwakwa', a boo rla' mbe múè mo neè gul ce e m ce raañger aèmboè glaês.	The construction of its wall was jasper. The city was pure gold, like pure glass.
Ñwáè moè' aè ka' ba ce e ce sár yi ená buu ca yu wa' ka', baná ñgaèñ aè ba rïìñ ená weèr ce geèe ba buu ca, bcor wááwá vi ce geèe wa' foñ.	But if any man seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither do God's assemblies.
Nfeè' aè káè' a ce gháá ce a be ye ñkaè' neè bráâd ce a láè yes njo ka', ce a m ce too ená Ñkaâ' caèasi-mndap.	Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.
Jisoès aè bipshi enáê, “AÈ joèo nda máè?” Beèe wááwá a kanïì ená a joèo ye ka'. Pitaè aè laa enáê, “Masaè, yu ba beèe ce a yu goèr a ce nyoèrni a ka' ce cïìrshi wáè mbetar.”	"Jesus said, ""Who touched me?"" When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, ""Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, 'Who touched me?'"""
Jisos Kraâis aè m vúè njep ñgoèñ, a caa njep mdip ba bláá. E m caèa ba njep mdip caè'caè' ka', e m caèa ba njep mdip ba bláá. Yú' yi m suñ aèmboè ye foñ njobeè' Yú' yu mini.	This is he who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not with the water only, but with the water and the blood. It is the Spirit who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.
E ce nyʉ̀ʼsi muu ca nè rfàʼ.	He is overburdening this child with work.
E laa neè woweèe enáê, “Baná ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir wááwá ce a yá'ni buu kúú Nyúè, a yu aèmboè ñwáè ndap ce e fúr buu bfi ba buu brúèú embe dïì' ce e ke láè yïì buu.”	"He said to them, ""Therefore, every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things."""
Jisoès aè m laèa neè ñger-ñwáè enáê, “Ñwáè aè ka' byemi neè máè baná ñgaèñ aè ku byemi ba neè máè ka', e byemi foñ neè ñwáè ce e m tuu máè.	"Jesus cried out and said, ""Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me."
Kǔundap zhi ka kɛ̀ɛti banɛ ndap be gwè.	If the foundation collapses then the house will fall.
Beèe a be vúèse aè mntáâ' aè bto' wááwá enjep ñgoèñ. Be ba beèe ce wap bli vi yu jáá jáèá jáá. Woweèe a be vúè wa'a, fyá' bgúâú beèe anaè aè mnoâñ btaar ba bá', byemi ená ñwáè tuñ bgúâú beèe anaè ka'.	From among the peoples, tribes, languages, and nations people will look at their dead bodies for three and a half days, and will not allow their dead bodies to be laid in a tomb.
Rfaè' ca yu lo rfaè' ka'. AÈ túr bo njo ka' njobeè' yo ntee yi yu rara aè bsii Nyúè ka'.	You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart isn't right before God.
Fa koosi neè bbor ka', faè' neè tatap. Faè' neè neè Tata Nyúè neè ye ntee-ñwáè.	not lagging in diligence; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè nfúr weâr AÈpoloès, máè loo ye se ená e vú a bfúr mo' weèe vú ca'ni weèe, e yá yi ená yi yu boèñboñ ená e vú seè'ni ka'. E ka' lo koni nfeè', e ka' vúê.	Now concerning Apollos, the brother, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers; and it was not at all his desire to come now; but he will come when he has an opportunity.
Ñwáè ce e byemi neè Muu Nyúè, ñgaèñ rïìñ wa'a njep yeâ ntee. Ñwáè ce e byemi ka' ce loèr Nyúè aè ñwáè mnde', njobeè' ce e byemi yuu ce Nyúè aè laèa kuu Muu yïì ka'.	He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. He who doesn't believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has given concerning his Son.
A m boo ñka' anaè mbenduè bluèr ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú. A m sañ mlii beèe ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú ce a m ba ñgaâa ntuu neè Muu Njeeè mbe bluèr anaè.	The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them twelve names of the twelve Apostles of the Lamb.
E ka' mïìsi, a laa beèe aè da'seè a duse.	When he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
baná weèe fa naèa tu ená weèe aè caèa mmba' ce ce a m faèrshi efa Oleèf ce aè mñkúè naè ka'. Weèe aè ka' ce naèa nyor, weèe kuushi ená yu ba weèe ce weèe ce geèe mñgaâñ ce vi ce kuè' ka', yu ba mñgaâñ ce ce vi geèe weèe aè ka' ce kuè'.	don't boast over the branches. But if you boast, it is not you who support the root, but the root supports you.
Nyúè ce e ke sañ, túr rboèñ li, ñwáá yi túr rboèñ li, mkaèñsïì mi túr rboèñ lap, lap rboèñ anaè li ba jáá jáèá jáá.	There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.
Weèr aè ka' baè' mbe dïì' mo' yá rla' Saiproès, a ma'shi li aè bo ñkoèp a caa a du a ba' aè ñgoâñ Sirïìyaè. Keñ aè du a táá aè rla' Tayaè tá a bo fúshi buu embo aèfo.	When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria, and landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo.
Yi ka' ba wa'a, máè ce laèa neè weèe seè'ni ená weèe ma' ndeâe mbembep ba bsaèrbuu. Nyúè ce byeè vi blaèa njep weâe mntee, baná weèe mú' wee mntee, yu' vi neè rbonïì-ñwáè. AÈde' vi gee weèe luêñ.	Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
Woweèe a ka' yu' aèmboè e laèa neè woweèe ba aè li Hibruè, woweèe a misïì a cu nyoèñ. Pol aè laa enáê,	When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,
E laa neè ñwáè ce e m ce fyá' yi ñka' enáê, ‘Yáê, yu seè'ni bfeâ' btaar aèmboè máè vúè a fyá' mbe ce ca a yá yi yú ka'. Gwaèr yi, yi ce bepsi nshe ca aè cicïì njoká.’	He said to the vine dresser, 'Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?'
Yee ŋgwè zhi ghɛɛ ɛ.	Your carrots are ready for harvest.
E fa buu ntaa nè ye à cicì.	He has given the goods to him without pay.
Weèe ce weèe yu ñgaâa mbo'ni, weâe rïìñ aè rfyá' buu, riñ aèmboè ñgoèñ yi be ba, ker yá aèmboè rbuu li yu, weèe ku riñ yuu ce yi be ba. Weèe aè ka' ke' riñ aè rfyá' buu ce vi ce koni aè nfeè' yïû seè'ni, rïìñ yuu ce yi be ba ka' njoká?	You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don't interpret this time?
Ndap moè' yu ce aè buu efa rbaè'ri ñwáè ka'. Ka' yi yu wa'a, ñwáè ce e m geèe buu wááwá yu Nyúè.	For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.
A bi yeè ñwáè rjaè' aè rla' Dávïìd ntïìni na. A ye Kraâis anaè ce e yu Tataê.	For there is born to you, this day, in the city of David, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
Yuu ce Nyúè aè m laèa neè ye yi m ba ená yïì ñgúè be loè bkïìloè, cu aè ñgoâñ beèe mo' tá beèe anaè a gee woweèe a kúti bkwaèa, jar neè woweèe aè bfeè' mjeèe kyeèe.	God spoke in this way: that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
AÈ ka' ba koni ká koni weèr, weèr ce duèñshi ená weèr yu ñgaâa mfaè' neè Nyúè. Weèr ce duèñshi wa'a aè njáèá njïì ce weèr aè kur ntee seê, a táá tatap aè nfeè' ce weèr ce yá ñgá', ba aè nfeè' ce fuèp aè koo weèr, ker ba aè nfeè' ce buu aè ka' tap neè weèr.	but in everything commending ourselves, as servants of God, in great endurance, in afflictions, in hardships, in distresses,
Jisoès aè laa enáê, “Pitaè, m ce suñ wáè máná tá nduñgúp ka' toñ neètú' e ntïìni na, aè be kani ñkaèraè' taar ená aè rïìñ máè ka'.”	"He said, ""I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times."""
Ka' Máèlkisidáèk aè m ba raèraâ Lávïì ka' wa'a, e m koni buu ese Abraèham ce e yu ñwáè ce Nyúè aè m kaè' buu neè ye, a ghoni ye.	but he whose genealogy is not counted from them has accepted tithes from Abraham, and has blessed him who has the promises.
Geewa'a, nfeè' moè' be ba ce a be koo nduu-guèu tá woweèe a ji mdip aè nfeè' anaè.	But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.
M ce loo máná Tata Jisos Kraâis túr weèe aè ntee boèñboñ, tá Nyúè koñ weèe, tá Yú' Rara yi gee weèe ba aèbee.	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.
Ñwáè moè' aè m ba aè rla' anaè a ce too ená Saèkiyoès. E m ba tu neè ñgaâa ñkuèu mbaâa baèraè', a túr mbaèa foñ seê.	There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
Muu ca ce ceni nlàa sê.	This child is speak very quickly.
“Weèe aè ka' ce geèe rloo, weèe fa geèe aèmboè ñgaâa mbo'ni a ke geèe naè ka'. Woweèe a ke koèñ aè rtáá mbekïì aè mndap mloo ker ba aè btase, gee rloo tá beèe a bo yá woweèe. M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè, woweèe a koo wap blaè' wáá.	"When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	6	Wáè ka' ce loo, aè du mbe wáâ rum ndap, cete keèñ, loo neè yoè Ta ce a ke yá ye ka', tá yoè Ta ca ce e ke yá buu ce beèe a geèe aè bsúèti bo laè' wáè.	But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	7	Weèe ka' ce loo, weèe fa ce laèa blaâa bcicïì aèmboè beèe enje jáá a ke geèe naè ka'. Woweèe a ke geèe wa'a ce kwaè'shi ená Nyúè be yu' map mloo njobeè' woweèe a loo laa buu goèr.	In praying, don't use vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	8	Weèe fa ba aèmboè woweèe ka', njobeè' yeè Ta rïìñ yuu ce weèe aè buu wáá, tá weèe ka' keèe bipshi ená e gee yi neè weèe.	Therefore don't be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	9	Baná weèe ce loo ba aè njáèá enáê, ‘Yeèr Ta ce e yu embe buèu, tá lo rlii li ba rrara,	Pray like this: 'Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	10	tá yo kúú yi ká', tá beèe a gee yuu ce aè ce koèñ njep ñgoèñ na aèmboè a ce geèe mbe buèu.	Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	11	Fa weèr byee ce vi ghááte neè weèr ntïìni.	Give us today our daily bread.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	12	Foèosi weèr efa yeèr buu bbebep aèmboè wee weèr aè foèosi beèe ce a geèe buu bbebep neè weèr.	Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	13	Fa maè'shi tá rmoèoshïì li vú neè weèr ka', fúr weèr embaè mmbo Sataèn ce e yu ñwáâ mbembep. [Geèe buu ca neè weèr njobeè' kúú yu yo, ñger aè ba yo, bkuè' aè ba wo nfeseè. Yi yu wa'a.]’	Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	6	14	Weèe aè ka' foosi beèe ce a geèe buu bbebep neè weèe, baná yeè Ta embe buèu be foèosi weèe foñ.	For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you."
E natïì a lor muu ba ma a du aègho aè ñgoâñ Isráèl.	He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
Máè yá ncïìndap Nyúè moè' aèmboè e táá aè nyúè. E m waa a ká'shi bsiñ ce vi ke ye bgúâú buu, a laa neè vi enáê, “Vúè neè aèbee ye ku' ñkaè' ce Nyúè aè ká'.	"I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the sky, ""Come! Be gathered together to the great supper of God,"
Taantoʼ tʉr njoʼ mbe tù.	Tanto has a patch of hair on his head.
Yá neè yuu ce njáèá ñkoosimnse ce Nyúè koèñ na aè geèe neè weèe. E geèe weèe aè lor buu tatap seê, a ka yeè njo. E geèe nyor aè bep weèe, weèe a ce báèáñger, a ce koèñ ená seèe ba cuâu mo'sir, ntee yi ce luèu weèe aè rgeèe buu bboèñboñ. E geèe weèe aè tamïì nyor aè rsa' ñwáè ce e geèe yuu bebep. Weèe aè duèñshi ená weèe túr bo njep yuu bebep anaè ka' koo múcaèr.	For behold, this same thing, that you were made sorry in a godly way, what earnest care it worked in you. Yes, what defense, indignation, fear, longing, zeal, and vengeance! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in the matter.
E ka' laèa buu ca wa'a, beèe magoèr a byemïì neè ye.	As he spoke these things, many believed in him.
Mkwe mi koo mbe loʼ ha sê.	Many people have died these days.
Ñwáâ ñká' aè laa neè yïì ta enáê, ‘Yaè taê, gaèp bti' fa wa.’ E ka' laèa wa'a, e lor yïì buu a gap neè woweèe.	The younger of them said to his father, 'Father, give me my share of your property.' He divided his livelihood between them.
E ce geèe rloo wa'a, Nyúè aè gee e yá ñwáè moè' ce li rlii li yu ená AÈnaèniyaès aèmboè e vúè a niñ mbe ndaèp a lá mmbo mbe yeâ nduè tá e bo yá buu.”	"and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight."""
Jisoès aè riñ yuu ce woweèe a ce laèa, a laa neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe ce le rbyemïì li yu múcaèr, weèe ce laèa fa weâe mú ená weèe túr bráâd ka' njoká?	"Jesus, perceiving it, said, ""Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, 'because you have brought no bread?'"
Baná weèr aè byemi yer ba rkwe, tá weèe bo koni ryoèñ.	So then death works in us, but life in you.
a ku ba a woweèe aè rïìñ aè bfeè' mñkyeèe a ce kur ntee neè woweèe aèfo.	For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.
AÈ ka' ba aè noèñ entoèmbïì embe múè ñgaèa, aè mú ñgaèptú' seê, bbyeèñge anaè a lor mgúr ce a m kupshi, a du faèdïì' ce rsheè li m ba.	But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.
Ka' ba ená máè bú' ncir a gee yuu mo' ce a ba yú máè, m kanïì efa rkwe ka'. Ka' ba ená buu ce Jus a laèa aèmboè máè na vi yu mini ka', ñwáè moè' túr ñger aè rkoo máè fa neè woweèe ka'. M ce koèñ máná a sa' wa mnsa' ba njeptii ñkwe Ruêm.”	"For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don't refuse to die; but if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!"""
Yo kuèu yi ka' gee wáè aè gee yuu bebep, aè tee yi ma'; yi yu aèndeèe ená aè niñ mbe dïû' rcu ce nfeseè, buu kuèu, neè ce ená aè túr mkuèu mmbaa, tá a ma' wáè njep mor.	where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.' If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched--
Weâe gee wa'a, baná weèe aè loèr yeè ndeèe a siñsi mncir Nyúè aègho. Ku' buu moè' yu foñ aèmboè bca, ce weâe ke geèe.”	"making void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this."""
Ñgúè buu moè' aè gweñgeèr yi ba mbenduè nshe ce e m ba mbenduè ryáá. Ñgúè buu anaè aè yañseè a fúú njobeè' nshe e mbenduè ryáá anaè aè m ba goèr ka'.	Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn't have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.
Mnoèñ mo' vi ka' caèa, ÁÈlisabáèt aè koo rbúè, a cu mbe ndaèp mñwáá taê, a ker ce fúú aè múè beèe ka'.	After these days Elizabeth, his wife, conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying,
E m duè a yá Pailáèt, a laa neè ye ená e fa gúâú ñwáè neè ye tá e tuñ. Pailáèt aè byemïì.	This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus' body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.
Weèr aè ka' baè' aèfo, tu neè bsoogáè rjeèe yi yá keñ yïû aè rla' AÈláèksandaè ce e m ce duè aè to' Italeè, a fa weèr mbo.	There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.
Jisoès aè ka' yá wa'a, a laa enáê, “Yi yu tatap seê, neè ñgaâa mbaèa aè rniñ mbe dïû' kúú Nyúè.	"Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, ""How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!"
Sèe luusi ŋgòŋ nè bii.	Let us stimulate the place with a dance.
Kyer wɛ̀, kù fa mɛ̀ wo labaʼ.	I beg you, just give me your shoes.
Beèe ce Nyúè aè m laèa ená woweèe a be feese muu yïì naè, e m ká' woweèe. Beèe ce Nyúè aè m ká' anaè, e m geèe woweèe a ba byáánïì. Beèe ce e m geèe woweèe a ba byáánïì naè, e m kuè'si woweèe foñ.	Whom he predestined, those he also called. Whom he called, those he also justified. Whom he justified, those he also glorified.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' moè' Jisoès aè ba aè rla' mo', mbañruèñwáè moè' aè ba aèfo ce msaèasïì mi m koo ye aè nyor wááwá. E ka' yá Jisoès a gwe njep nsheè neè bsii, a bu' mmbo neè ye a laa enáê, “Tataê, wáè ka' koêñ, aè gee m ke'seè, ba nrara.”	"It happened, while he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged him, saying, ""Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean."""
Beèe a ka' kaari aèbee, Pailáèt aè bipshïì neè woweèe enáê, “Ñwáè ce weèe ce koèñ ená m fúr embe shañ fa neè weèe yu nda? M fúr ba Baèrabaès káè Jisoès ce a too ená Kraâis naè?”	"When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, ""Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?"""
Tá rlu'shïì li ba mbe buèu, ker ba neè beèe wááwá ce a ce cu mbo. Yi yu bebep neè beèe enjep ñgoèñ na ba mdip wááwá, njobeè' a maè' Sataèn embe buèu, e suu a ce cu a woweèe. Ntee yi ce yañ ye, njobeè' e rïìñ ená yïì nfeè' ku báti ba múcaèr seê.”	"Therefore rejoice, heavens, and you who dwell in them. Woe to the earth and to the sea, because the devil has gone down to you, having great wrath, knowing that he has but a short time."""
Beèe wááwá a ku ce kwaè'shi ba aèmboè wap btu, a ke' ce kwaè'shi aèmboè yuu ce Jisoès ce roèo ka'.	For they all seek their own, not the things of Jesus Christ.
E laa neè beèe caè ená woweèe a cute aè nsheè.	He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground;
Nyúè aè m fa muu yïì nta' ce yi caèa mnta' bcïìndap Nyúè. Cena yi ku ba foñ aèmboè rlii ce Nyúè aè fa neè ye li caa mlii bcïìndap Nyúè naè.	having become so much better than the angels, as he has inherited a more excellent name than they have.
Làa ne Nfòmi enɛ e vʉ cɛr.	Tell Nformi that he should come quickly.
AÈ ka' ba aè mú ñgaèptú', beâe bgoèrgoèr efa múè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì, ba bleebeâe aè to', ba ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir, ba bár ñgaâa kansuèr wááwá a seesïì aèmboè a be geèe neè Jisoès. A ka' seèesi wáá, a kur ye, a du aègho a fa neè Pailáèt.	Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
A m laèa neè woweèe ená woweèe a fúú embe kansuèr. Woweèe a ka' fúú, ñgaâa kansuèr a ká' a ce seèesi yuu ce a be geèe neè woweèe.	But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
Jisoès aè m cu aè mbeèp dïì' ce a m ce fa mbaèa mbe Ndaèp Nyúè, a ce fyá' aèmboè beèe a ce láè mbaèa njep ñkuèp rfa. Ñgaâa mbaèa a m fa mbaèa seê.	Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.
Beèe ce a m ba aèfo a yá yuu ce yi m koni, a suñ beèe ce a m vúè naè aèmboè a m geèe ñwáè anaè aè luêñ.	Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.
Ñwáè efa weâe mú ce mluè mi ka' ce koo ye, e kyeseè noâñ mo' mbenduè vi mnoèñ enjep ñgoèñ na a nda?	Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?
Byemi neè neè rraa ca aèmboè li ku bii fa weâe mú na, tá weèe bo ba boo ce aè rraa.” Jisoès aè ka' laèa blaèa ca mïìsi, a lá'si nyor efa múè beèe a du a cu mimñgi'.	"While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become children of light."" Jesus said these things, and he departed and hid himself from them."
A m maè'shi woweèe, woweèe a natïì a du aè rla' Antïìyoèk, a ka' baè', a baashi ñgaâa rbyemïì wááwá mbe dïû' mo'sir, a fa ñwaè' anaè neè woweèe.	So, when they were sent off, they came to Antioch. Having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.
Túè' aè ka' raa, bjep vi ba aè múè bsoogáè se njobeè' woweèe a m rïìñ yuu ce yi m koni Pitaè ka'.	Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.
Woweèe a ka' taa ye mbe kïìntaa, a lor vi bcáè' a ma' kaèñ aègho tá a bo yá aèmboè a be gaèp. A ka' gaèp wáá,	When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,
Beèe mo' efa woweèe a m táá mbe múè mcuèñ mor, mor yi too woweèe ka'. Weèe mo' a m luèñ efa bïìr. Ka' woweèe a m ba bgoè'sïì wa'a, a m ku lo a gee buu btatap. Beèe mo' a m túr ñger aè rmaè' bïìr. Beèe mo' a m juèu ñgaâa maè' bïûr aè bto' mo'.	quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, grew mighty in war, and caused foreign armies to flee.
M ce laèa cena neè wáè aè bsii Nyúè, ba aè bsii Jisos Kraêis, ker ba foñ aè bsii bcïìndap Nyúè ce Nyúè aè ce. M ce laèa tatap seê, ená aè gee buu ce m ce laèa neè wáè na, ke' ce so'niñgoèñ ka'. Gee neè beèe wááwá yáánïì.	I command you in the sight of God, and Christ Jesus, and the chosen angels, that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by partiality.
M ̀ be tarshi kǎa bàa ha.	I will repair this torn bag.
Jisoès a ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu weèe a du mbe dïì' mo' embe rtuèu anaè ce a m ce too ená Gáètsámanïì, e laa neè woweèe enáê, “Cu neè mbena tá m du nje na duè geèe rloo.”	"Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, ""Sit here, while I go there and pray."""
E ka' baè', a yá ñwáè moè' embe ndúè' Juês, ce a m ce too ená AÈkwilaè. A m bi ye aè rla' Pontuès. E m loâ aè rla' Italeè a ñgwa yïì ce a m ce too ená Preèsilaè njobeè' ñkúú Klaâdïìyoès aè m fa rsa' ená Jus a fúú aè rla' Rum duse. Pol aè m duè aè ryá woweèe,	He found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race, who had recently come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome. He came to them,
Weèe fa maè'shi tá ñgúè' moè' efa yeè nyor kúti ba yuu ce weèe be ce geèe buu bbebep aègho ka'. Fa neè yeè nyor ba neè Nyúè aèmboè beèe ce a kweñger, a kúti bteèe. Maè'shi neè tá yeè nyor wááwá ba ba yuu ce Nyúè be ce geèe mfaâ' myáánïì aègho.	Neither present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness, but present yourselves to God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.
Beèe a yá aèmboè woweèe a ce duè, a riñ woweèe, a fúúse efa mla' wááwá, a cañse a du a ba' aè dïì' anaè entombïì.	They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.
E koo ye à kùu.	He held him by the leg.
njobeè' noèñ yïû Muu Ñwáè yi be ba aèmboè mbeèñ ce e ke baèp rbuu li raa, káâ' a mbuèu rbuu mo' du ba' aè rmo' naè.	for as the lightning, when it flashes out of the one part under the sky, shines to the other part under the sky; so will the Son of Man be in his day.
Rïìñ neè mbe dïì' ce weèe táá. Weèe táá ba mbe dïì' ce beèe Isráèl a m be táá naè ka'. Woweèe a m táá aègee rtuèu ce a m ce too ená Sinaèi. AÈ m ba rtuèu ce aède' ñwáè aè m ba joêo. AÈ m ba aè nfeè' anaè mcuèñ mor mi ko' mbekïì, túè' aè sii bïìp, fu' yi ce caèa tatap seê.	For you have not come to a mountain that might be touched, and that burned with fire, and to blackness, darkness, storm,
Beèe a vúâ aè ñgoâñ Frijïìyaè ba Paèmfilïìyaè ker ba aè ñgoâñ Ijïìp ba bdïì' moâ' aè to' Lebïìyaè ce vi yu aègee Saèireên. Beèe mo' efa weâr mú ce a vúâ aè ñgoâñ Ruêm, yu Juês, ba beèe mo' enje jáá ce a byemi neè Nyúè Juês.	Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
Beèe mo' a laa enáê, “ÁÈno, a ye.” Beèe mo' a laa yap enáê, “AÈi', e ku feese ye feese.” E laa yi ená “A máè ñwáè anaè.”	"Others were saying, ""It is he."" Still others were saying, ""He looks like him."" He said, ""I am he."""
Pol aè ka' baè' mbe dïì' ce a be loè embo ce ko' ko', beèe a gúmïì a yeâ nduè, bsoogáè a boñlaèr a byá' ye.	When he came to the stairs, it happened that he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;
Woweèe a be keè rïìñ Nyúè ba aè mñguèpcuèu keè' rïìñ ye enjep ntee ka', Fa táá kuèu weèe njáèá beèe anaè ka'.	holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also.
Andruè, Feleêp, Baètoèlomïì, Matïìyoè, Tomaês, Jáms ce e m ba muu Alfïìyoès, ba Taèdiyoès. Saimúèn ce e m ba moè' efa múè beèe Siloèt,	Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;
Muu Ñwáè be keèe tuu vi bcïìndap tá woweèe a baashi buu ce vi ke geèe beèe a ce geèe buu bbebep, ker ba ñgaâa ñgeèe buu bbebep wááwá embe dïì' yi kúú,	The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will gather out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and those who do iniquity,
Weèe fa buumi ka'. Lá' neè, tapsi ryoèñ cor ce li báti naè, faè dïì' li ba'si kwe ka'. Máè yá máná ye ñgeèe yi ghááte aè bsii Nyúè ka'.	Wake up, and keep the things that remain, which you were about to throw away, for I have found no works of yours perfected before my God.
Pailáèt aè ka' yá ená yuu geèe yi ker ba ka', bghaa vi ce roèo ko' aè múè beèe, e lor mdip a su'si mi mmbo aègho aè bsii beèe, a laa enáê, “Ya bo yi yu njep rkwe ñwáè ca ka', kwaè' weèe.”	"So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, ""I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it."""
À be kwe tɛɛ ŋgùu waa wɛ̀ njo yòo tʉʼ ba yòo buu bbebep.	When you die sasswood medicine will cause your stomach to swell because of your evil deeds.
a yoñshi Nyúè, a bá'shi, a laa enáê, “Ca yu yaè nyor ce máè fa a weâe btuè. Ce gee neè aèmboè seèe ce geèe na tá weèe bo ce kuushi máè.”	"When he had given thanks, he broke it, and said, ""Take, eat. This is my body, which is broken for you. Do this in memory of me."""
Cɛ̀ʼ ce wɛ̀ sùʼsi anà zhi raa kaʼ.	The cloth that you have washed is not clean.
E laa neè woweèe enáê, “AÈde' ñwáè wááwá byemïì yuu ca ka'. Beèe ce aède' a byemïì ku ba beèe ce Nyúè aè geèe ená woweèe a byemi.	"But he said to them, ""Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given."
AÈ m ba nyúè anaè beèe a mmbaa efa waâp mú a ce duè aè mú rla' mo' ce a m ce too ená Ámayoès. AÈ rnaètïû aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm duè aè rla' ca yi yu aèmboè mar saèambaê.	Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.
AÈde' ñwáè sánïì ená ñwáè ce e ke ghoèni ñwáè, yu ñwáâ ñgoèr a caa ñwáè ce e ghoèni naè ka'.	But without any dispute the lesser is blessed by the greater.
Weèr ce loèr nfeè' neè ku' rfa ca, faè dïì' beèe mo' a lo ce de'ñger kuèu rfa anaè ka'.	We are avoiding this, that any man should blame us concerning this abundance which is administered by us.
Jisoès aè m koni muu jaèaki', a ko' a cu mbo, aèmboè a m sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè naè. A m sañ mbo enáê,	Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written,
Koni neè beèe ce a ce niñ weèe, gá' neè woweèe boèñboñ. Wee geèe wa' weèe fa ce de'ñger ka'.	Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
M ce suñ weèe ená yuu ce a sañ mbe Ñwaâ' Nyúè enáê, ‘A m beè' ye aè múè ñgaâa ñgeèe buu bbebep’ naè, yi be koni neè máè, ghááte njo. Neè mini-ñwáè, yuu ce a sañ aèmboè máè yi ce ghááte njo.”	"For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: 'He was counted with transgressors.' For that which concerns me has an end."""
E laèa buu ca mbe vi mñwaè' wááwá ce e sañ. Buu moè' yu mbe vi mñwaè' ce vi tap seê. Beèe ce a máñni buu a táá tatap ka', a loè beesi buu ca aè njáèá yaèp aèmboè a beèesi blaèa moè' embe Ñwaâ' Nyúè naè. Yuu ce woweèe a ce geèe anaè yi be maè' ñgá' mbe waâp btuè.	as also in all of his letters, speaking in them of these things. In those, there are some things that are hard to understand, which the ignorant and unsettled twist, as they also do to the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.
Muu aè ka' baè' mnoèñ waami, a vú aè rgeèe búè muu. Beèe a m ce kwaè'shi ená a be cu' ba yïì taê.	It happened on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of the father.
E mɛŋni buu sê.	He is very incapable.
Jisoès aè laa neè ye enáê, “AÈ ce laèa wáná, ‘ka' ba ená aède' aè gee yuu mo'’ wa'a, a ce laèa ba ená ká? Buu wááwá yu aètáèr neè ñwáè ce e byemi.”	"Jesus said to him, ""If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes."""
Ca yi m ba wa' tá yuu ce AÈsayaè ñwáè ncep ntuu Nyúè aè m laèa, yi bo ghááte njo.	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
E m ku túr seè'ni ba ñwáè moè'sir aè rtuu, ce aè m ba muu yïì ce e m koèñ magoèr. E m loè a tuu ye aèlúèsimbuèu, a ce kwaè'shi ená a be yu'ni neè muu yïì ca.	Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, 'They will respect my son.'
Yuu ce ñgaâa ntuu Jisoès aè m ce geèe naè yi m cïì' ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì, a ci' yïì beèe ce a m ba beèe Saduèsïî, woweèe a ko'ndoñ neè ñgaâa ntuu Jisoès seê.	But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy,
Mɛ̀ riŋ à rsɛɛ ntàʼ brɛ̀reŋ.	I know how to make a bamboo chair.
Nyúè e loè gee yuu anaè yi túr njáèá nyor ce e koèñ ená yi ba túr. E loè gee buu jáá jáèá jáá vi túr nyor jáá jáèá jáá.	But God gives it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.
A m túúshi beèe mo' efa woweèe neè bluèr a kweñgeèr, a gwate beèe mo' efa woweèe a teni bkúèkúâ bbaa. A m yúshi beèe mo' efa woweèe neè bkaèafaè'. Beèe ce a m ce yá ñgá' na a m ba ñgaâa fuèp. Woweèe a m ce yar ba mñgúp mbú. Beèe a m fa woweèe ñgá' a jar neè woweèe seê.	They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated
Caè'ni neè btu embe coêr, ker ca'ni beèe Nyúè wááwá neè máè. Beèe Nyúè ce aè to' Italeè a caè'ni weèe foñ.	Greet all of your leaders and all the saints. The Italians greet you.
aè ka' ce ce tu embe coêr, aè ce ba ñwáè ce beèe a rïìñ ená e yu ñwáâ mboèñmboñ, a túr ñgwa moè'sir caè'caè', boo vi foñ a ba ñgaâa rbyemïì, yap ñgeèe aè ba njáèá ñgeèe ce aède' beèe a yá laa ená woweèe a ce geèe buu bbebep káè ená a teèe btu ka'.	if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.
Woweèe a ka' ce túúshi Stáfaèn neè bluèr, e loo a laa enáê, “Tata Jisoès, koo la ryoèñ.”	"They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying, ""Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!"""
E m kúti aè laè', a yá aèmboè muu yïì noèñ mbe bkuu, yú' nyúèrkaè' anaè yi banïì fúú enjep ye.	She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.
Wáè koèñ ñgeâe boèñboñ, a baa ñgeâe bebep. A mbuèu ce Nyúè ce e yu yoè Nyúè aè ce wáè ená aè ba ñwáâ ñgoèr ce lu'shi caa bfúr wo.”	"You have loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows."""
a laa enáê, “Wáè ce aède' aè sa'sïì Ndap Nyúè, baè'ri aè mnoâñ btaar, jaè' laè yo tu. Yi ka' ba ená aè yu Muu Nyúè, suèu laè embe kïìntaa.”	"and saying, ""You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!"""
E ka' laèa wa'a, a ká' a ce lapni mla' faèdïì' ce e m geèe ku' buu bghagha' naè, njobeè' beâe aèfo a m kupse a ma' yaèp buu bbebep ka'.	Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn't repent.
M ̀ be kwesi ce anà àyàŋsè.	I will kill that tree tomorrow.
Kuèu buu byáánïì njobeè' m ce duè aè ryá yaè Taê, tá weèe ker yá máè ka',	about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won't see me any more;
Ñgá' ce koni weèr aè mnjïì wááwá, weèr aè ke' bornïì rfaè' ca ka'. E ba aè nfeè' moè' bfee vi jep weèr, ntee yi ke' kwe weèr efa rfaè' ca ka'.	We are pressed on every side, yet not crushed; perplexed, yet not to despair;
int.	not fit.
faè dïì' Sataèn lo túr ñger mbe seâe nduè ka'. Seèe rïìñ ená Sataèn yu kwáèá.	that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his schemes.
Bfúr waè, aèmboè yi yu wa'a, baná weèe gheter gee ba buu ce vi be duèñshi ghup ená Nyúè aè ce weèe. Weèe aè ka' ce geèe wa'a weèe ke gwe rmoèoshïì aè nfeè' moè' ka'.	Therefore, brothers, be more diligent to make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never stumble.
E m ce yá'ni mbe Ndaèp Nyúè aè mnoèñ wááwá. Beâe bgoèrgoèr efa múè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì ba ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir ker ba beèe ce a m ba boo mlii, a m ce gheèter aè ryú ye.	He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.
M ce laèa wa'a njobeè' máè yá máná ñwáè moè' aè ka' vú fe'shi aèmboè Jisoès moè' caa efa yïì ce weèr aè m feè'shi naè, weèe ku byemi. Ñwáè moè' ka' laa aèmboè yú' mo' ce yu yú' jáá, weèe ku byemi. Ñwáè moè' ka' fe'shi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ moè' ce e yu jáá efa yïì ce weèr aè m feè'shi aèmboè Jisos Kraâis naè, weèe ku byemi, koo buu ca wááwá mmbo mmbaa.	"For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we did not preach, or if you receive a different spirit, which you did not receive, or a different ""good news"", which you did not accept, you put up with that well enough."
Yi yu ba ená weèe yu'ni ba neè Kraâis aèmboè Tataê, neè ye ntee-ñwáè. Tami neè nyor aè nfeè' wááwá aè rbeèesi ñwáè wááwá ce e ka' bipshi ená weèe suñ mbuèu efa yuu ce weèe cu ce keè'.	But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts; and always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason concerning the hope that is in you, with humility and fear:
Ca yi ka' mïì wáá, Jisoès aè fúú, a ka' ce duè a yá aèmboè ñwáè ñkuèu mbaâa baèraè' moè' ce a m ce too ye ená Lávïì cu mbe yi dïû' rfaè'. Jisoès aè laa neè ye enáê, “Vúè fa máâ mbuèu.”	"After these things he went out, and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, ""Follow me!"""
E ke kèʼ bàŋrìbàŋrì àmbò nyɛ̀ɛ waʼa.	He looks suspicious like a thief.
Yuu ce Nyúè aè laèa yi yu ená e fa seèe ryoèñ ce nfeseè. Ryoèñ ca li ce loè ese muu yïì.	The testimony is this, that God gave to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
Weèe rïìñ yuu ce yi m koni aè ñgoâñ Judaè wááwá. Yi m káâ' aè ñgoâñ Galeèleê, rfeè'shïì ce Joân aè m ce feè'shi tá e bo baèptir beèe naè li m banïì caa wáá.	you yourselves know what happened, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
Woweèe a m suñ yaèp buu bbebep ce a m geèe, e baptïìr woweèe njep rdip Jodaèn.	They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
Wáè ka' ce geèe ñkaè', aè be ba ñgaâa fuèp, ba beèe ce a kepñger, ba mntáèñ, ba beèe ce a feèp.	But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;
Yi yu foñ ená ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì ce aè m ba raèraâ Lávïì naè a m ba aèñgoo njobeè' aè m ba beèe ce a be loè kweñger, tá lap rfaè' li mïì.	Many, indeed, have been made priests, because they are hindered from continuing by death.
Moè' efa woweèe aè ka' yá ená e keè'se, a kúti a ce yoèp mbekïì seê, a ce yoèñshi Nyúè.	One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.
Yáê, e ce vúè mbe múè mmbaè'. Beèe wááwá a be yá ye. Beèe ce a m soèp ye neè rkoèñ a be yá ye foñ. Beâe aè bto' wááwá enjep ñgoèñ na a be war ená a m ba riñ a m ba byemi neè ye. ÁÈno, yi yu wa'a.	Behold, he is coming with the clouds, and every eye will see him, including those who pierced him. All the tribes of the earth will mourn over him. Even so, Amen.
A tuñ seèe Jisos Kraâis weèe aèbee aè baèptir ce a m baèptir seèe naè, yi ba ená seèe woweèe aè kweñger aèbee. A m geèe ená seèe woweèe kweñger aèbee tá seèe bo koni ryoèñ, geèe ba ñgeâe fi aèmboè Jisos Kraâis aè m fúú efa rkwe aè ñger Taèr Nyúè, a koni ryoèñ foñ naè.	We were buried therefore with him through baptism to death, that just like Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we also might walk in newness of life.
Woweèe a ka' yu' yuu ce ñkúú aè laèa, a nati a ce duè, a ku yá aèm boè rkaèñsïì ce woweèe a m yá kuè mbuèuntii naè li ce duè kuèntombïì neè woweèe caar a ba' a táá mbe dïì' ce muu anaè aè m ba.	They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.
Felep aè m duè aè mú bu' rla' mo' aè ñgoâñ Saèmarïìyaè, a suñ aèmboè Kraâis anaè neè beâe aèfo.	Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed to them the Christ.
Ñwáè ce e jaè' máè a sañ mú ñwaè' ca neè weèe a Sïìlïìvanoès. E yu nfúr ce m rïìñ máná e yu ñwáâ mini. Máè sañ tá m bo fa weèe ñger, keèr suñ weèe máná rboâñntee Nyúè li yu aèmboè máè m suñ weèe naè neè mini-ñwáè. Táá neè njo tatap.	Through Silvanus, our faithful brother, as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.
“M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená ñwáè ce e ka' byemi neè máè, baná e be geèe buu ce m ce geèe, keèr geèe buu ce vi caèa vi ce m ce geèe njobeè' m ce duè aè rcu weèr Taèr.	Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.

M ce suñ weèe ba yuu ce weèr aè m suñ weèe naè. Ñwáè moè' aè ka' ker fe'shi nsuñ mboèñmboñ moè' ce e yu jáá efa yïì ce weèr aè m feè'shi neè weèe, weèe aè yu' a byemi naè, ndoèo co' ye.	"As we have said before, so I now say again: if any man preaches to you any ""good news"" other than that which you received, let him be cursed."
a yááti aèwañ seè'ni na. Buu ce ñgaâa ncep ntuu Nyúè a m sañ vi geèe buu ca aè yááti aèwañ neè beèe enje jáá. Nyúè ce e ce cu nfeseè aè m laèa ená buu ca yááti neè beèe enje jáá wa'a, tá bto' wááwá vi bo byemi, yu'ni neè ye.	nan

A láè vi mbe buèu neè weèe,	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy became our father again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, to an incorruptible and undefiled inheritance that doesn't fade away, reserved in Heaven for you,

A ka' yá ye, a lor ye a vú aègho aè rla' Antïìyoèk. Woweèe a m cu a ñgaâa cor weèe aè feè' bïìi, a yá'ni beèe magoèr seê. A m káè' a too ñgaâa yá'ni buu Jisoès ená ñgaâa rbyemïì ba aè rla' Antïìyoèk.
