A m yú ye, mmbañruè ce a m ce duè a yeâ mbuèu a da'seè, yuu ce woweèe a m ce koèñ aè rgeèe naè yi bú aè cicïì.	For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.
Be ba aè nfeè' ce Nyúè aè geèe seèe aè riñ buu wááwá tá buu ca mïî.	but when that which is complete has come, then that which is partial will be done away with.
njobeè' buu enjep ñgoèñ vi loè ese Taèr ka', vi loè ese ñgoèñ. Buu enjep ñgoèñ ca yu buu bbebep ce nyor ce roèo, ba mbaèñ mmir aè rtúr buu wááwá ce aè ce yá, ker ba naèanyor aè buu ce aè túr.	For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, isn't the Father's, but is the world's.
Yi yu ená Nyúè aè fa beèe wááwá aè shañ nteèetu, tá e bo koosimnse neè woweèe wááwá.	For God has shut up all to disobedience, that he might have mercy on all.
E ker bipshi neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe ce roèo ba nda?” Woweèe a ker laa enáê, “Jisoès ce aè rla' Nasaráèt.”	"Again therefore he asked them, ""Who are you looking for?"" They said, ""Jesus of Nazareth."""
M ̀̀ be dù ser Bìŋkà nè mkùu.	I will go to Binka on foot.
Nàʼ yoo zhi yû?	Where are your own cows.
M ku ce geèe ba aèmboè Taèr aè suñ máè ená m geêe, tá ñgoèñ yi bo rïìñ ená máè koèñ ye. Naèti neè tá seèe du aè dïû' jáá.”	But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.
Saimúèn aè laa enáê, “Loo neè neè Tata Nyúè neè máè ená yuu mo' efa yuu weèe aè laèa na yi fa koni máè ka'.”	"Simon answered, ""Pray for me to the Lord, that none of the things which you have spoken happen to me."""
Yi ka' ba wa'a, Nyúè aè ma'shïì ená woweèe a gee buu ce a ce koèñ aè rgeèe, aè ba buu ce vi yu neè rïìtu-ñwáè. Bbyeèñge a kupse yuu ce ñwáè aè ba geèe, a ce geèe ba yuu ce ñwáè aè ba geèe ka'.	For this reason, God gave them up to vile passions. For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature.
E ka' koo, buu bteèe caè ba beâe bgoèrgoèr caè a gwe njeptii njeèe anaè. Woweèe a m túr rluñ rmo'sir rmo'sir, a ker túr ghee ce a geèe neè gul yi mo'sir mo'sir, mgúr mo' ce mi m ce rúèú boèñboñ seê, mi ba njo, a táá aètu rloo beèe Nyúè.	Now when he had taken the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each one having a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.
Kraâis ka' ba njep weèe, ka' weêe mnyor vi kweñger njobeè' buu bbebep wa'a, weèe yu bteèe aè yú' njobeè' e geèe weèe aè ba byáánïì.	If Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is alive because of righteousness.
Beèe Isráèl a yu ñgaâa bbaèa neè Nyúè njobeè' woweèe a kani Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ. Cena yu sá' neè weèe ce weèe yu beèe enje jáá. Ka' yi yu wa'a, e m ce woweèe a ku bii koèñ woweèe njobeè' wap btaê.	Concerning the Good News, they are enemies for your sake. But concerning the election, they are beloved for the fathers' sake.
Ñwáè ce e laèa ená e ce cu aèbee a Nyúè, ñgaèñ túr aè rcu aèmboè Jisoès aè m ce cu.	he who says he remains in him ought himself also to walk just like he walked.
A ba fyeèni mgúr ca tá yi caa btosïìn mjeèe mtaar tá a lor mbaèa anaè fa neè ñgaâa fuèp.” Woweèe a ka' laèa wa'a, a lapni njeñwáè ca seê.	"For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and given to the poor."" They grumbled against her."
Woweèe a ka' tuu neèñguu roè wáá, a cúú keñ aèwaâa roè, a ba seè'ni ba aè ñgoâñ Gáènásaráèt.	When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
Mmbaè' vi vúê, a cete woweèe, njeèndoñ aè laa enjep múè mo enáê, “Cena yu muu waè ce m koèñ seê. Ce yu' neè yuu ce e ce laèa.”	"A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, ""This is my beloved Son. Listen to him."""
AÈde' ñwáè konïì ba njáèá sá' ká, ce e ka' túr buu enjep ñgoèñ na wááwá, lo bá li ryoèñ?	For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?
Ñwáè wááwá ce laèa boèñboñ kuu Dáèmitroès. Ka' yïì ndeâe mini foñ ce duèñshi wa'a. Wer weèr foñ ce laèa boèñboñ kuu ye. Wáè rïìñ wáná yuu ce weèr ce laèa yi yu mini.	Demetrius has the testimony of all, and of the truth itself; yes, we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.
A lo a ká' a ce maè' bïìr mbe buèu. Ncïìndap Nyúè ce a ce too ená Maikáèl ba bcïìndap ce a m ba njep yeâ tïìi a m maè' bïìr a nyaèa ce e m feese nyaèaroè naè. Nyaèa anaè ba vi bcïìndap a m maè' bïìr a Maikáèl weèe tatap seê.	There was war in the sky. Michael and his angels made war on the dragon. The dragon and his angels made war.
Mboè weèe rïìñ ená weêe mnyor yu ñgúè' moè' efa nyor Jisos kraâis a? Baná aède' ñwáè lor yïì nyor ce yu ñgúè' moè' efa nyor Jisos Kraêis, gee tá e ba ñgúè' moè' efa nyor kwaèraè a? Ka'! AÈtaè yi ba wa' ka'.	Don't you know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ, and make them members of a prostitute? May it never be!
Jisoès ce a too li rlii mo' ená Jostoès aè caè'ni weèe foñ. Ku ba beèe a mntaar ca ce a yu Jus aè múè beèe ce weèr woweèe ce faè'. Weèr woweèe ce faè' wa'a tá beèe a bo rïìñ aèmboè kúú Nyúè. Woweèe a fa máè ñger magoèr seê.	and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for the Kingdom of God who are of the circumcision, men who have been a comfort to me.
Pitaè aè ker kani. E ka' kani wa'a, nduñgúp aè ku toñ.	Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.
E ka' yá Jisoès, a waa, a gwe njep yeâ tïìi, a ce war enáê, “Jisoès, Muu Nyúè embe buèu, yuu ce soè túr a ká? M ce loo neè wáè ená aè fa fa máè ñgá' ka'.”	"When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, ""What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torment me!"""
Seemoè' yi yu ená ye ce OÈnásimoès aè m cañ ese wáè duè cu nfeè' múcaèr, e kúti bo cu weèe ye nfeseè.	For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while, that you would have him forever,
Ncir entoèmbïì ce mkaè'ni mi yu aègee mo yi yu enáê, “Yu'ni neè yo ta ba yo maê.” Mkaè'ni anaè mi yu enáê,	Honor your father and mother, which is the first commandment with a promise:
Seemoè' aèmboè máè m kúti a vú ka' naè, weèe ce kwaè'shi ená m yu njáèá ñwáè ce e ke kupse ntee aèfo aèfo. Waè' m ka' ce kwaè'shi yuu ce m be geèe, m kwa'shïì aèmboè beèe enjep ñgoèñ na ce a ke byemi yuu, ker lo kani naè a?	"When I therefore was thus determined, did I show fickleness? Or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be the ""Yes, yes"" and the ""No, no?"""
Beèe a ka' yu' wa'a, a bááñger aè ryá'nïì ce e m yá'ni anaè seê.	When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.
Jisoès aè laa neè ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu enáê, “M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená yi yu tatap neè ñwáè mbaèa aè rniñ mbe dïû' kúú Nyúè.	"Jesus said to his disciples, ""Most certainly I say to you, a rich man will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven with difficulty."
Yuènismoès ce e yu muu weèe aè vúè a ye. E yu nfúr ce weèr koèñ seê. E ce duè aèmbuèu Jisoès neè yi ntee wááwá. Woweèe a be suñ weèe buu ce vi koni weèr aèfa wááwá.	together with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you everything that is going on here.
Kuèu yi ka' laa enáê, “M yu ñgúè' moè' efa nyor ka, njobeè' m yu bo ka',” waè' baná kuèu yi buu efa rba ñgúè' moè' efa nyor a?	"If the foot would say, ""Because I'm not the hand, I'm not part of the body,"" it is not therefore not part of the body."
A ka' duè aègho, a vú neè beèe ená a vú táá njïìnsa' mnaèñ, laa enáê, “Ñwáè ca aè be buu efa rlaèa yuu bebep aèmboè dïû' rara ca ba mncir Musïìs ka'.	"and set up false witnesses who said, ""This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law."
Mɛ̀ ba du a koni ye kaʼ.	I went and did not meet him.
Wɛ̌ yùp ŋgùp nyàa à fa nè mɛ̀.	When you skin the animal, give the skin to me.
M ce kwaè'shi aè rduè njïû aè ñgoâñ Máèsáèdonïìyaè ka' vúè caè'ni weèe.	But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia, for I am passing through Macedonia.
Beèe mo' a m vúè neè ñwáè moè' ce e m fuñre a ke' yi aè rlaèa yuu boèñboñ foñ ka', a bu' mmbo neè Jisoès ená e naa mi mmbo mbenduè ñwáè anaè, ja' ye.	They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.
Beèe wááwá a ye, a yu'. Ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu a baashïì bbábá' ce vi m báti, vi ruu aè mñkaèa saèambaê.	They all ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.
Weèe aè rïìñ yuu ce yi geèe ená ñwáè anaè fa vúè seè'ni ka', tá e bo loè vúè ba aè nfeè' yïì.	Now you know what is restraining him, to the end that he may be revealed in his own season.
beèe ce a m tááte aèfo a bipshïì neè woweèe enáê, “Weèe ce fyáèá muu jaèaki' anaè njoká?”	"Some of those who stood there asked them, ""What are you doing, untying the young donkey?"""
Ka' cu, njeñwáè moâ' aè ñgoèñ anaè ce aè m ku ba njeñwáè efa múè beèe Kánaèn aè vúê, a waa, a laa enáê, “Tataê, Muu Dávïìd, koosimnse neè máè! Yú' nyúèrkaè' yi m niñ njep muu waè, e ce yu' ryañ seê.”	"Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders, and cried, saying, ""Have mercy on me, Lord, you son of David! My daughter is severely demonized!"""
Máè yu' aèmboè njeèndoñ aè suèu embe buèu a laa enáê, “Sañ blaèa ca: ‘Ká' e seè'ni, mboâñtu mi yu neè beèe ce a láè ntee neè Tata Jisoès wáá a ka' kwe.’ ” Yú' Nyúè yi beesïì enáê, “Yi yu wa'a, lap rfaè' li mïì. Woweèe a be lúèshi ce lu'shi, njobeè' sá' efa map mfaè' be duè a waâp mbuèu.”	"I heard the voice from heaven saying, ""Write, 'Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.'"" ""Yes,"" says the Spirit, ""that they may rest from their labors; for their works follow with them."""
Weèr aè du a ba' aè rla' Sïìrakusaè a cu aèfo mnoâñ btaar.	Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days.
Máè yu' yuu mo' yi coo máè mbaè tuè' aèmboè njeèndoñ ma kúr beèe wa'a. Njeèndoñ anaè aè m ba aèmboè njeèndoñ rdip ce li ce gweè aè rkoñ wa'a, a ker wañger aèmboè mbeèñ wa'a. Njeèndoñ anaè aè m waa enáê, “AÈleèluyaè. Nyúè ce e yu yïìseèe Tataê, ce e túr buu wááwá mba yeâ mmboè, yu ñkúú enjep ñgoèñ na seè'ni.	"I heard something like the voice of a great multitude, and like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of mighty thunders, saying, ""Hallelujah! For the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns!"
Beèe Farïìsi a ka' yu' ená Jisoès aè cipsi cuèu ese beèe Saduèsïî, woweèe a kuu nyor a vú a yá ye.	But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, gathered themselves together.
E m be geèe yuu mo' bebep ka'. Mnde' mi m be fúú eku yeâ cuèu ka'.	"who did not sin, ""neither was deceit found in his mouth."""
Yi ka' ba wa'a, Pol aè báá woweèe a laa enáê, “Beèe caê, máè yá máná liseèe rjáèr ca li be ba yáánïì ka'. Seèe ka' loâ aèfa baná yïìseèe buu be bep, tá keñ bep, tá beèe a kweñger foñ.”	"and said to them, ""Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives."""
Njeŋwɛ̀ ca rìŋ à rkap tɛʼ sê.	This woman knows how to fold loincloth.
Ka' yi yu wa'a, Jus moâ' aè ñgoâñ Áshaè a m ba aèfo. Woweèe a ba vúè táá a wáâ bsii, laèa yuu, ce yi ka' ba ená woweèe a túr yuu kuu máè.	They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.
Sò kǔ jɛr mʉfɛ̀ɛ.	Let us walk gently.
Weèe ce weèe yu ñgaâa ñgeèe buu bbebep, aè ka' riñ aè rfa buu bboèñboñ neè boo wee, yi ba yi ká aèmboè yeè Ta embe buèu. Mboè e be fa Yú' Rara neè beèe ce a loo ená e fa woweèe a?”	"If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?"""
Ce woweèe, lá woweèe rara neè yoè mini. Wo blaèa yu mini.	Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.
Bdikïìn a túr aè rba beèe ce a túr bbyeèñge aèñgoo ka', ba beèe ce a ce keè' aè boo wap ba wap mndap boèñboñ.	Let servants be husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
“Be keèe be aè nfeè' ce Muu Ñwáè aè vúè neè yi foèo-ñwáè a bcïìndap Nyúè wááwá naè, tá e cu mbe yi kaèbaèraè' foèo,	"But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	32	tá beâe aè bto' wááwá a kaari, táá njep yeâ tïìi, tá e gapse woweèe nto' baa aèmboè gaèy e ke fúr njeèe efa múè mbú-ndoñ naè.	Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	33	E be tár njeèe aè yi bo maè', tár mbú-ndoñ aè yi bo ñkoèp.	He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	34	Ñkúú e geèe wa' wáá, laa neè beâe aè yi bo maè' enáê, ‘Weèe yu beèe ce yeè ta aè ghoèni. Vúè neè koo bti', niñ mbe dïû' kúú ce Nyúè aè m kupshi a lá neè weèe káâ' aè nfeè' ce a m geèe ñgoèñ,	Then the King will tell those on his right hand, 'Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world;
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	35	njobeè' njeè aè m ce yañ máè, weèe aè fa máè byee. Ntee yi m yuushi máè, weèe aè fa máè yuu no. Máè m ba kïìloè, weèe aè konïì máè.	for I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	36	Máè m ba mbuèuriñ, weèe aè fa máè bcáè'. Máè m ce yañ, weèe aè vú a ca'ni máè. Máè m ba mbe shañ, weèe aè vú a ca'ni máè.’	I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	37	E ce laèa wa'a, beâe byáánïì caè a laa neè ye enáê, ‘Tataê, weèr aè m yá wáè ba aè se'ká, njeè aè ce yañ wáè, weèr aè fa wáè byee, káè ntee yi ce yuushi wáè weèr aè fa wáè yuu no?	Then the righteous will answer him, saying, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?"
Ñwaâ' Nyúè yi laèa enáê, “Yú' ce Nyúè aè fa neè seèe yi koèñ magoèr ená seèe ku yu'ni ba neè Nyúè.” Waè' yi laèa ba aè cicïì a?	"Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, ""The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously""?"
Agripaè aè laa neè Pol enáê, “AÂ kwaè'shi ená aède' aè ku lor nfeè' múcaècaèr wa'a, gee m ba ñwáè rbyemïì a?”	"Agrippa said to Paul, ""With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?"""
M ce koèñ ená weèe riñ ená Timotïì aè fúú embe shañ seè'ni. E ka' vú yá máè, tá m lor ye, weèr ye vú yá weèe.	Know that our brother Timothy has been freed, with whom, if he comes shortly, I will see you.
Kò kwâa ca du ghaʼ mbe ŋgòʼ.	Take this corn and crack it with the mill.
Beèe magoèr ce a yu entombïì seè'ni na, a be keèe ba elúèsimbuèu, tá beèe magoèr ce a yu elúèsimbuèu seè'ni na, a ba entombïì.	But many will be last who are first; and first who are last.
E ka' ce de' a ye, a ye a niñ mbe ndaèp, e yá ku' beèe aèmboè a cu mbo.	As he talked with him, he went in and found many gathered together.
A m yú ye njo' yïìseèe buu bbebep, Nyúè aè fúr ye efa rkwe tá seèe bo ba byáánïì a yeâ bsii.	who was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification.
Seèe yu' rboèñ, lu'shi, ku'si Nyúè, njobeè' nfeè' aè gháá ce Muu Njeèe be tarshi bguèu. Ñgwa yïì aè tami nyor aè bguèu anaè foñ.	"Let us rejoice and be exceedingly glad, and let us give the glory to him. For the marriage of the Lamb has come, and his wife has made herself ready."""
Yàa tâ à tòʼsi mɛ̀ nè mbàŋ njobèʼ mɛ̀ dù ŋguu kaʼ.	My father pointed at me with a staff because I did not go for firewood.
Yu ba rkoèñnïì Kraâis ce li geèe ntee yi ce luèu weèr aè rgeèe njáèá buu ca, njobeè' weèr rïìñ ená ñwáè moè'sir ka' kwe aè btu beèe wááwá, baná beèe wááwá aè kweñger.	For the love of Christ constrains us; because we judge thus, that one died for all, therefore all died.
Baná weèe ker bii bkwaèa ka'. Weèe yu seè'ni ba boo. AÈ ka' ba njobeè' weèe yu boo Nyúè, baná weèe be koni buu wááwá ce e kupshi a lá neè boo vi naè.	So you are no longer a bondservant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
M ce laèa ba máná ñwáè moè' aè m be yá Taèr ka', ku ba ñwáè ce e m loè ese Nyúè ce e yá Taèr.	Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.
Mluè mi koo ñkúú seê, aè ka' ba njobeè' e m ye leè' aè bsii beèe ce a m vúè ñkaè' ca, e laa ená a fa yuu ce e laèa ená a fa neè ye naè.	The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths, and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded it to be given,
Yi ka' ba wa'a, buu bbaa vi yu ce aède' vi kupseè ka' njobeè' aède' Nyúè laa wa'a nya' ba mnde' ka'. Buu bbaa anaè a buu ce vi ce fa seèe ñger tá seèe ce seèe aè cañ a súni njeptii Nyúè seèe bo rïìñ neè mini-ñwáè ená seèe be koni buu ce Nyúè aè kaè' neè seèe.	that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.
À ba tɛ ba nkapni kaʼ mor zhi ba lǒ efɛ̀?	If it was not a mystery where did the fire come from?
Jisos Kraâis aè m fa yïì nyor a seâe tuè, tá Nyúè bo foèosi seèe efa yïìseèe buu bbebep, tee seèe efa ñgeâe bbebep enjep ñgoèñ na. E m geèe ba yuu ce Nyúè ce e yu yïìseèe Ta aè m koèñ ená yi ba.	who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father--
Muu wàa à mʉ vʉ̂.	My child came.
Buu bbebep be keèr túr ñger mbe weâe nduè ka' njobeè' weèe ker bii njeptii mncir ka', weèe yu ba njeptii rboâñntee Nyúè.	For sin will not have dominion over you. For you are not under law, but under grace.
M ̀ be fʉʉ jùu mrʉ̀ʼ àyaŋse.	I will search for wine tomorrow.
Jisoès aè beesïì neè ye enáê, “Ncir entombïì yu ca: ‘Beèe Isráèl, yu' neè! Yïìseèe Tata Nyúè ku ba moè'sir.	"Jesus answered, ""The greatest is, 'Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:"
Baná aèmboè cor ce yu'ni neè Kraâis naè, yi yu yáánïì ená bbyeèñge a yu'ni neè bduu wap aè buu wááwá.	But as the assembly is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their own husbands in everything.
E ka' laèa wa'a, beèe mo' efa múè ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir a laa fa waâp mú enáê, “Ñwáè ca ce bepsi rlii Nyúè.”	"Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, ""This man blasphemes."""
Máè ka' fyá' a yá ñwáè moè' aè táá mbetar btábuèr ca a ba aèmboè muu ñwáè wa'a. E m maè' saèaro aè nyoèr, a cúú kúè cáè' ce a geèe neè guêl, nje ñguèñ.	And among the lampstands was one like a son of man, clothed with a robe reaching down to his feet, and with a golden sash around his chest.
weèe aè ka' fa rgú'shïì neè ñwáè ce e suèsi nyor naè, laa neè ye enáê, “Vúè cu mbe nta' boèñboñ ca,” laa neè ñwáè fuèp ca yi ba enáê, “Táá yo mbonaè, buwa'laèr aè sárnïì aè nsheè mbe máâ geñ mkuèu na,”	"and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, ""Sit here in a good place;"" and you tell the poor man, ""Stand there,"" or ""Sit by my footstool;"""
E m ba neè rgha'nïì-ñwáè aè ryá ená beèe a byemi ka'. E m naèti, a ce kar aè mla' mo', a ce yá'ni beèe blaâa Nyúè.	He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.
M ̀ be sùu mbà làʼ dù yɛ ye.	I will go down to the compound and see him.
Ku ba ye Nyúè ce e túr bfee. Seèe ku'si ye aè nfeè' sïìp njo' yuu ce Jisos Kraâis aè m geèe! Yi yu wa'a.	nan
Yi ku ba ba ená ñgá' be koni seèe tá liseèe rfaè' ca li kwe ntaa ka', beèe a be keèr loèr ndap nyúè AÈtámïìs anaè aè yuu ka', tá nyúè ca seese ce beâe aè ñgoâñ Áshaè wááwá a ce caè'ni na, ker kúti ba yïì ce aède' beèe a yu'nïì neè ye ka'.”	"Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing, and her majesty destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worships."""
Buu ca vi ce duèñshi ená Nyúè rïìñ njáèá njïì ce e be jaè' yïì beèe efa ñgá', a ker riñ njáèá njïì ce e be fa ñgá' neè beâe bbebep caar duè baè' aè nfeè' ce e be sa' ñgoèñ.	the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation and to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the day of judgment;
Gheèter vú tá ñgoèñ yi ka' fúte. Yuèbuloès ba Pudaèn ba Lainoès ba Klaâudïìyaè ker ba bfúr wááwá, a caè'ni wáè.	Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.
Máè rïìñ máná woweèe a láè ntee aè rduè aèmbuèu Nyúè, a ke' riñ njïû mini ka'.	For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
Tǎatà à ta bor nje ndèe.	Tata has kicked the ball into the goal.
Woweèe a ka' niñ njep rsheè, a yá muu nsuènsuè moè' aèmboè e cu aè ñgúè' bo maè', a yar ñgaèbúlaâ mbúú. Nyor aè bañ woweèe seê.	Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.
Woweèe a ka' jáèr aè to' ca wááwá, baè' aè rla' Pafoès, a yá ñwáè fii moè' ce a m ce too ená Baâajisoès. E m ba ñwáè Jus ce e m ce bo' beèe ená e yu ñwáè ncep ntuu Nyúè.	When they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus,
[Felep aè laa enáê, “Wáè ka' byemi neè yo ntee-ñwáè, m baptïìr wáè.” E beesïì enáê, “Máè byemi ená Jisos Kraâis yu muu Nyúè.”]	nan
Woweèe a ka' duè baè' aè rla' Áfásoès, Pol aè ma'shïì Preèsilaè ba AÈkwilaè aèfo. E m du mbe ndaèp rloo a suñ Jus buu aèmboè Jisoès.	He came to Ephesus, and he left them there; but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
Koni bcòcò enjep mdip.	Scoop out the herbs from the water.
Geewa'a, beèe mo' efa waâp mú ce a m ba beâe aè to' Saiproès ba rla' Saèiren a m baè' aè rla' Antïìyoèk a fe'shi blaâa Nyúè neè beèe enje jáá foñ. Woweèe a m feè'shi Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ aèmboè Tata Jisoès neè beèe anaè.	But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.
Ŋkar zhìi à koʼ ce, a ròo gwè.	His friend climbed a tree and almost fell.
Moè' efa buu bteèe ce vi m ba kyeèe naè aè fa bcïìndap Nyúè saèamba ca bghee ce a geèe neè gul vi saèambaê. Rshentee Nyúè ce e ku ba nteèe aè nfeè' wááwá li m ba njep bghee anaè jiñ.	One of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.
Yi ka' ba wa'a bfúr weêr, táá neè tatap, ku lá ba ryá'nïì ce weèr aè m yá'ni weèe a ker sañ neè weèe naè nje tuè.	So then, brothers, stand firm, and hold the traditions which you were taught by us, whether by word, or by letter.
Woweèe a m nyáá neè foèo-ñwáè a ce de' a Jisoès aèmboè li rkwe ce yi m ba ená e be kwe aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm, mïìsi li rfaè'.	who appeared in glory, and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
Máè rïìñ ñwáè Jisos Kraâis moè' ce a m loèr ye a du aègho mbe laèlaè rbuu. Káè ñwáè anaè aè m duè ba neè yïì nyor áè, káè e m duè ba neè yïì nyor ka' áè, m rïìñ ka'. Ñwáè ce e rïìñ ku ba Nyúè caè'caè'. Yu seè'ni bfeè' ncoèp-kyeèe-aè-rrúèú aèmboè ca yi m koni.	I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago (whether in the body, I don't know, or whether out of the body, I don't know; God knows), such a one caught up into the third heaven.
Ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè bsoogáè rjeèe ce e m táá a ce keè'ni Jisoès, aè ka' yá aèmboè e kwe, e laa enáê, “Ñwáè ca aè m ba Muu Nyúè ghup.”	"When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, ""Truly this man was the Son of God!"""
Woweèe a ka' yu', a laa a waâp mú enáê, “Ñwáè aè vúè neè byee a fa neè ye a?”	"The disciples therefore said one to another, ""Has anyone brought him something to eat?"""
AÈde' aè laa neè nfúroè enáê, ‘Nfúraè, naèa rlir tá m koo wáè mú ñkúè' ce enjo,’ ke' yá ntaañguu ce e yu wáè nje rlïìr naè ka' aè njáâá ká? Wáè ce aè yu ñwáè mbo'ni, fúr ntaañguu ce e yu nje rlïìr njep wáè wáá tá aè bo yá mú ñkúè' ce ce yi yu nje rlïìr nje nfúroè boèñboñ, ka' fúr.	Or how can you tell your brother, 'Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,' when you yourself don't see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè weèe, beèe wááwá a rïìñ ená weèe yu beèe ce weèe ce yu'ni neè Tataê. M ce lu'shi neè weèe seê. Ka' yi yu wa'a, m ce koèñ máná weèe riñ yuu boèñboñ, máñni yuu bebep.	For your obedience has become known to all. I rejoice therefore over you. But I desire to have you wise in that which is good, but innocent in that which is evil.
E m koo nyaèa ce e m feese nyaèaroè naè a kyáá neè shañ anaè, e cu aègho aè bfeè' ncúèkïì. Nyaèa ca yu nyo ce e m ba eluâuñgoèñ, aè ba nyaèa ce a ce too rlii efa gho ená nyúèrkaè', a ker ce too rmo' ená Sataèn naè.	He seized the dragon, the old serpent, which is the devil and Satan, who deceives the whole inhabited earth, and bound him for a thousand years,
Beèe Farïìsi ba ñgaâa ryá'ni mncir a bipshïì neè Jisoès enáê, “Ñgaâa yá'ni yoè buu a láè ndeèe viseèe bta ka', a ce ye buu neè mmbo msii njoká?”	"The Pharisees and the scribes asked him, ""Why don't your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?"""
Ñwáè ryá'ni mncir anaè aè laa neè ye enáê, “Wáè laèa yáánïì seê, ñwáè ryá'nïì. Wáè laèa mini wáná, Nyúè ku ba moè'sir, moè' ker ba ka', ku ba ye.	"The scribe said to him, ""Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he,"
ÁÈpafraès ce e yu muu weèe, a ker ba ñwáè rfaè' neè Jisos Kraêis, aè caè'ni weèe. E ce loo neè weèe aè nfeè' wááwá ená Nyúè gee tá weèe táá tatap, ba aèmboè Nyúè ce koèñ ená weèe aè ba ba, rïìñ buu ce Nyúè ce koèñ ená weèe aè ba geèe, geèe buu anaè wááwá.	Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, salutes you, always striving for you in his prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
Woweèe a taa ye mbe kïìntaa, a lor vi bcáè' a ma' kañ aègho, tá a bo yá aèmboè a be gaèp.	Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.
Ñwáè wááwá ce e ka' ce wáp Nyúè, ce geèe yuu ce yi yu yáánïì, káè ñgaèñ yu ñwáâ aè to' efá áè, baná Nyúè be koo ye mmbo mmbaa.	but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.
Nyúè aè m ba fúr Jisos Kraâis efa rkwe ka' yi ba ba ená le rbyemïì li yu aè cicïì, yeè buu bbebep aè ku bii mbe weâe btuè.	If Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.
“Ñwáè aè ka' be wáè aè Ñkaâ' bguèu, aè fa cu ba mbe nta' yïû boèñboñ ka', njobeè' aède' yi ku ba ená ñgaèñ aè ba be ñwáè moè' ce e yu ñwáâ ñgoèr neè wáè.	"When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast, don't sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him,
Luke	Luêk	14	9	Yi ka' ba wa'a baná ñwáè ce e ba be weèe ye naè be vúè laèa neè wáè enáê, ‘Naèti mbekïì tá ñwáè ca cu.’ E ce laèa wa'a, baná aè be naèti mbekïì neè rïìtu-ñwáè duè cu mbe mú nta' ká'.	and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, 'Make room for this person.' Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.
Luke	Luêk	14	10	A ka' be wáè aè ñkaè', aè cu ba mbe mú nta' ká', ñwáè ce e ba be weèe naè ka' vúê, tá e bo laèa neè wáè enáê, ‘Ñkaraè, naèti embo naè, cu mbe nta' boèñboñ ca.’ E ka' gee wa'a baná e naèa wáè mbekïì aè múè beèe ce e ba be naè.	But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, 'Friend, move up higher.' Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.
Luke	Luêk	14	11	Yi yu ená ñwáè ce e ka' naa yïì nyor mbekïì baná a be suèusi ye njep nsheè. Ñwáè ce e ka' suusi yïì nyor njep nsheè baná a be naèa ye mbekïì.”	For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted."
Ñgaâa ñgeèe cumúnyañ a ka' bye cumúnyañ aè múè beèe, e ku', baná a be kep ba ñgeâe boèñboñ.	Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
AÈde' m suñ weèe buu wááwá ce rbyemïì li m geèe beèe mo' foñ a gee ka'. M ka' lo ená m ce suñ, m suñ du ba' fá? Nfeè' yu aègho ce m suñ weèe aèmboè Gidïìyoèn, ba Baraèk, ba Saâmsïìn, ba Jáptaè, ba Dávïìd, ba Saâmwáèl ker ba beèe wááwá ce a m ce cep ntuu Nyúè ka'.	What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets;
M ce bu' mmbo neè weèe seê, ená weèe loo neè weèr, tá m bo yaèñse koni fáñ keèr vúè yá weèe.	I strongly urge you to do this, that I may be restored to you sooner.
Woweèe a ká' a ce laèa fa waâp mú enáê, “E laèa wa'a njobeè' seèe aè ba vú neè bráâd ka'.”	"They reasoned with one another, saying, ""It's because we have no bread."""
baná ñwáè anaè ce naèa tu, a riñ yuu ka'. E ce señ buu, a ce sár mnsár aè mú blaèa jáá jáèá jáá. Cena yi geèe beèe a ce ko'ndoñ, a ce lapni, a ce cápni, beèe a ce kwaè'shi bebep kuu beèe mo'.	he is conceited, knowing nothing, but obsessed with arguments, disputes, and word battles, from which come envy, strife, insulting, evil suspicions,
AÈde' weèe ce naèa tu aè njáâá ká ce ñwáè moè' efa weâe mú ka' ce geèe njáèá yuu ca. Weèe aè ba ce war war. Weèe fúr ñwáè ca efa weâe mú.	You are puffed up, and didn't rather mourn, that he who had done this deed might be removed from among you.
Musïìs aè m ce kwaè'shi ená yïì beèe a be rïìñ ená e yu ñwáè ce Nyúè aè tuu ená e fúr woweèe efa ñgá'. Geewa'a, woweèe a riñ yap yu ka'.	He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn't understand.
E ce yuʼ rbòŋ njobèʼ e càa ŋwàʼ.	He is feeling fine because he passed the exams.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' anaè, nfeè' ce Jus a m ce ye ñkaâ' btaèp aè ká' a ce gháá.	Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand.
Ñwáè moè' ka' laa yi enáê. “M yu ya weèr Poêl,” moè' ker laa yi enáê, “M yu ya weèr AÈpoloès.” Waè' baná weèe yu jáá efa beèe enjep ñgoèñ na a?	"For when one says, ""I follow Paul,"" and another, ""I follow Apollos,"" aren't you fleshly?"
Woweèe a ka' yu' wa'a, a bááñger seê, a ma'shi ye, a duse.	When they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went away.
Yuu ce ñwáè mbyeè buu ca ce byeè, yu nlaèa Nyúè.	The farmer sows the word.
Nsuu ca aè m ku ba yo nsuu tá aè ka' keè fyeèni, wáè ka' fyeèni mbaèa efa gho aè ba yo mbaèa. Wáè kwaè'shi aè rgeèe njáèá yuu ca njoká? Wáè nya' mnde' ba neè beèe ka', wáè nya' mnde' ba neè Nyúè”	"While you kept it, didn't it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn't it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven't lied to men, but to God."""
Bár ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu ce beèe nrúú a ka' yu' yuu ce a bipshi na, yi bep woweèe seê.	When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.
Nyúè ce e m laèa enáê, “Maè'shi tá rraa li raa aè túè'nji,” yu ye ce e geèe li rraa li ce raa njep seâe mntee, tá seèe bo koni rraa, yá foèo Nyúè aèmboè yi ce raa aè bsii Kraêis.	"seeing it is God who said, ""Light will shine out of darkness,"" who has shone in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ."
Suñ beèe buu ca. Cep, ker lapni beèe neè ñger-ñwáè. Fa maè'shi tá ñwáè moè' lor wáè aètáèr ka'.	Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you.
E m koèñ ená buu wááwá ce e m geèe káè yu vïì embe buèu áè, káè yu vïì enjep ñgoèñ áè, a kúti aèbee njïì enjep muu yïì. AÈ ka' ba njo' rkwe ce muu yïì anaè aè m kwe mbe kïìntaa, Nyúè aè gee buu enjep ñgoèñ ba vïì embe buèu, vi kútïì bkar a ye, a cu neè rfúteè-ñwáè.	and through him to reconcile all things to himself, by him, whether things on the earth, or things in the heavens, having made peace through the blood of his cross.
Wɛ̀ mʉ yɛ ŋgar cà a?	Did you see that gun?
Mɛ̀ tʉr yaa ŋwàʼ, ŋgʉ̀ʼ mòʼ à ba nsii, mòʼ à ba mbʉʉ.	I have my book; one side is black, the other is white.
M ce suñ weèe buu ca njobeè' Muu Ñwáè be vúè neè foèo yïì Taê, a vi bcïìndap weèe, laè' ñwáè wááwá aè buu ce e m ce geèe.	For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.
Yuu ce m ce laèa yi yu ená Nyúè aè m caèa embenjïì Kraâis a gee a beèe enjep ñgoèñ na weèe a kútïì aèbee, a ke' ce beè' yaèp buu bbebep ka'. E fa nsuñ ca mba weâr mmboè ená weèr suñ neè beèe.	namely, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not reckoning to them their trespasses, and having committed to us the word of reconciliation.
AÈ m ba aè nfeè' yïì Saâmwáèl, woweèe a laa ená Nyúè fa woweèe ñkúú, Nyúè aè fa woweèe Sol ce e m ba muu Kïîsh, ce e m ba ñwáè embe ntáè' yïì Bánjamáèn. E m sa' kúú aè bfeè' mñkyeèe.	Afterward they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
Wèe tʉr à rkèʼni yee tu.	You have to take care of yourselves.
a seesi aèmboè a be geèe ka' koo Jisoès aè bfee, yú.	They took counsel together that they might take Jesus by deceit, and kill him.
M ̀ be fʉ dù ntaa.	I will go to market tomorrow.
Jisòs e ke gèe bèe a ce rlùŋ e.	Jesus saves people.
Woweèe a m suè' ye neè mcáp seê.	They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.
Máè yoèñshi weèe njobeè' weèe ce kuushi buu ce máè m yá'ni weèe, a ker ce geèe buu anaè yáánïì seê.	Now I praise you, brothers, that you remember me in all things, and hold firm the traditions, even as I delivered them to you.
E yu aèfa seè'ni na wa'a, beèe ce a yu btu neè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì a banïì fa ye ñger wáá ená e vú koo beèe ce a ce loo neè wáè, kur du aègho, fa mbe shañ.”	"Here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name."""
Ku' beèe a vúê, a sir ye a tarte, e niñ mbe keñ a cu mbo, beèe anaè a táá nje waâa túè.	Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach.
Jus ce a m ce cu aè rla' Antïìyoèk a ba ñgaâa rbyemïì foñ naè, a m koni ñgeâe cicïì ce Pitaè aè m ce geèe naè. Baènabaès ye ye aè m loè a ce geèe njáèá yap ñgeèe anaè.	And the rest of the Jews joined him in his hypocrisy; so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.
E ker bipshi neè woweèe enáê, “AÈ nfeè' máè m fa mntu' bráâd saèamba neè beèe ncúèkïì kyeèe naè, woweèe a m ye, weèe aè kwá' bbábá' aè mñkaâa bsá'?” Woweèe a beesïì enáê, “Weèr aè m kwáè' bbábá' aè mñkaèa saèambaê.”	"When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up? They told him, ""Seven."""
“AÈde' ñwáè cú' laêm, tár ba mbe dïì' ce beèe a be buu efa ryá káè lor ghee kúpshi aègho ka'. Ñwáè aè ka' cú' laêm, baná e be tár ba mbe tábuèr tá beèe ce a ce niñ mbe ndaèp a bo yá aèmboè ndap ce raa.	"No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.
Luke	Luêk	11	34	Mo mmir mi yu aèmboè lam wa'a neè yoè nyor. Mo mmir mi ka' ba mmboèñmboñ baná rraa li yu aè yoè nyor wááwá. Geewa'a, mo mmir mi ka' bep baná yoè nyor wááwá yu aè túè'nji.	The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.
Luke	Luêk	11	35	Baná weèe lor nfeè' yá weená rraa enjep weèe na li fa ba ba túè'nji ka'.	Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn't darkness.
Luke	Luêk	11	36	Baná rraa li ka' ba aè yoè nyor wááwá, ñgúè' moè' ke' ba aè túè'nji ka', baná rraa anaè li be raa wáè aè nyoèr wááwá aèmboè a ke cúè' lam e raa ñwáè aè nyoèr wááwá naè.”	If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light."
Ñwáè ka' túr ñger aè rcep ntuu Nyúè, ker túr ñger aè rrïìñ buu Nyúè ce vi yu aè bsúèti, ker riñ buu wááwá, ker byemi neè Nyúè btatap seê, ce aède' e laêa, rtuèu li co'tïì embe dïì' li táá, du táá aè dïû' jáá, e ka' tá koèñ beèe ka', baná e ku ba ñwáè cicïì.	If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but don't have love, I am nothing.
A ŋkar zhì àmbò e tɛɛ nje waaŋkʉ̀ nà.	That is his friend standing across the river.
Beâe bgoèrgoèr ca, a kwá' mbaèa anaè, a laa enáê, “Ncir yi byemi ená a lá mbaèa ca aè múè mbaèa embe Ndaèp Nyúè ka' njobeè' yu mbaèa bláá.”	"The chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said, ""It's not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood."""
AÈde' m naa tu njobeè' blaâa Nyúè ce m ce feè'shi neè weèe ka' njobeè' Nyúè aè m laèa neè máè ená m fe'shïî. Ndoèo be co' máè ce m ka' tá feè'shi ka'.	For if I preach the Good News, I have nothing to boast about; for necessity is laid on me; but woe is to me, if I don't preach the Good News.
Vi btuè' vi mú'ñgeèr, rlee li ba'ñgeèr ye, e ká' a ce laèa yáánïì.	Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.
Muu à diʼ a zhe njàp wɛɛ.	The child has finally eaten all the soup.
Ñwáè ce e ka' ce koèñ aè rboñshi li ryoèñ baná ñgaèñ be bá li, ñwáè ce e ka' tá boñshi li ryoèñ ka' njo' máè, baná ñgaèñ be koni li.	For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.
Woweèe a ka' vúèshi ye wáá, a co' cáâ' beer caè efa yeâ nyoèr, a lor vi bcáè', a kúsi ye aè nyoèr, a lor ye a du aègho aè rtaa mbe kïìntaa.	When they had mocked him, they took the robe off of him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.
M be kuè ce geèe yuu ce m ce geèe seè'ni na, faè dïì' beèe ce a ce koèñ aè ryu' nyor ená lap rfaè' li ku ba aèmboè ler naè a bo túr njïì moè' aè ryu' ka'.	But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them that desire an occasion, that in which they boast, they may be found even as we.
Muu anaè aè ku cañ a kúti, a du a laa neè ñkúú enáê, “M ce koèñ ená aè fa máè tu Joân ñwáè baèptir beèe njep kañ seè'ni.”	"She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked, ""I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter."""
Weèr Pol weèe aè ka' maè'shi woweèe, a niñ mbe keñ a du a ba' aè rla' Koês, a táá aè dïì' mo' ka'. Túè' aè ka' raa weèr aè ba' aè rla' Rodoèn, a ka' loâ aèfo, a du a ba' aè rlaè' Pataraè.	When it happened that we had parted from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos, and the next day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.
Ñwáè moè' ce e m ce duè aèmbuèu Jisoès aè m ba aè rla' Jopaè. Li rlii li m ba ená Taèbitaè; mbuèu efa rlii anaè aè ba ená Ñgap. E m ce geèe buu bboèñboñ seê, a ba mmbo mtoo.	Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.
“Be ba aè nfeè' anaè tá kúú Nyúè yi ba aèmboè nfeè' ce boo mñgoèñgoè mo' beèe nrúú a m loèr wap blaêm, a du aè rkoni nduu-guèu.	"Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	2	Bee nta efa waâp mú a m ba blúr, beèe nta a túr bfee.	Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	3	Beèe ce a m ba blúr naè a m loèr blaêm, a lor káèroèsin ka',	Those who were foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them,
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	4	beèe ce a m rïìñ buu naè a lá káèroèsin aè mú bgaloèn, a túr aègee waêp blaêm.	but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	5	Nduu-guèu a cu seê, mmirloè mi koo woweèe, woweèe a buumïì.	Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	6	AÈ ka' ba neè ntee-tú', ñwáè aè fuñ, a laa enáê, ‘A nduu-guèu e ce vúè naè, Fúú neè koni ye.’	But at midnight there was a cry, 'Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	7	Boo mñgoèñgoè anaè a lá'seè efa mmirloè, a ko'si waêp blaêm.	Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	8	Beèe ce a m ba blúr naè, a laa neè beèe ce a m túr bfee naè enáê, ‘Fa neè weèr yeè káèroèsin anaè moè' njobeè' weêr blam vi ce liiti.’	The foolish said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	9	Beèe ce a m túr bfee naè a beesïì enáê, ‘Weèr aè ka' gee wa'a, e ghááteè neè seèe wááwá ka'. Duè neè yá beèe ce a ce fyeèni, yuu yeè.’	But the wise answered, saying, 'What if there isn't enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	10	Woweèe a ka' duè aè ryuu, nduu-guèu aè ba'sïì, beèe ce a m tami nyor naè a du a nduu-guèu weèe mbe ndaèp aè rye Ñkaâ' bguèu, a cete keèñ.	While they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and the door was shut.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	11	Boo mñgoèñgoè mo' caè a lo a vúê, a laa enáê, ‘Masaè Masaè, múè' keèñ neè weèr.’	Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open to us.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	12	E beesïì yi yu enáê, ‘M ce laèa neè weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená m rïìñ weèe ka'.’	But he answered, 'Most certainly I tell you, I don't know you.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	13	Baná weèe fa ce buumi ka' njobeè' weèe rïìñ noèñ káè awaè ka'.	Watch therefore, for you don't know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	25	14	“Kúú Nyúè yi be ba foñ aèmboè aè nfeè' ce ñwáè moè' aè m ba aè rduè aè mbeè, a ká' yi ñgaâa mfaè', a lá yïì buu neè woweèe.	For it is like a man, going into another country, who called his own servants, and entrusted his goods to them."
Lávïì aè ba muu Simïìyoèn, Simïìyoèn aè ba muu Judaè, Judaè aè ba muu Josáèf, Josáèf aè ba muu Jonaèm, Jonaèm aè ba muu ÁÈliyakïìm,	the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,
Baná a m maè' mncir ce vi m ba entombïì njobeè' vi m túr ñger aè rjaè' beèe ka'.	For there is an annulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and uselessness

Beèe ce a m kúti anaè aè m ba Máèári ce aè rla' Makdalaè, ba Joèanaè, ba Máèári ce e m ba ma yïì Jáêms. Woweèe ba bbyeèñge mo' ce a woweèe a m ba naè a m suñ buu ca neè ñgaâa ntuu anaè. Zhi ce yɛti enɛ bèe à duse à mkʉʉ wɛɛwɛ.	It appears that everyone has gone to the farm.
M ce laèa wa'a a ce fa ba rsa' ka'. M ce koèñ ba aè rfeè' le rkoèñnïì aè rkoèñnïì lïû beèe mo', tá m bo yá máná le rkoèñnïì anaè li yu mini lá.	I speak not by way of commandment, but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love.

Fa bepsi rfaâ' Nyúè njo' byee ka'. Nyúè aè kani seèe efa rye njáèá byee mo' ka'. Ka' yi yu wa'a, wáè ka' ye yuu ce yi be geèe tá nfúroè gweê, baná wáè geèe yuu bebep. E yɛ à jaja.	He is seeing without the use of witchcraft.

À be fò ba kɛ enjep rfàʼ anà.	What will you benefit from that job.
Baènabaès ba Sol a ka' mïìsi yuu ce woweèe a m duè aè rgeèe aè rla' Jáèrusaláèm, a kúti. A ka' ce kúti, a lor Joèn Maêk.	Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their service, also taking with them John whose surname was Mark.

Laèa buu ca ker yá'ni vi.	Command and teach these things.

Bèesi cɛ̀ʼ àbʉ̀ʉsi.	Turn the frontal part of the cloth to the front.
“Yu' neè ñgaèa moè'. Ñwáè moè' aè m faè' yi nsuu, a bye njáèá msini ce a ke geèe mruè' aègho mbo, a bee ñka' a sir nsuu anaè aègho, a tuñ dïì' ce a bo geèe mruè' mbo a boo taè'taè' mbo foñ. E ka' geèe wa' wáá, a lá nsuu anaè neè beèe mo', a du aè mbeè.	"Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	34	Nfeè' ce a ke tee msini anaè aè ka' gháá, e tuu yi ñgaâa mfaè' ená a du yá beèe ce e m láè nsuu neè woweèe naè, koo msini mi.	When the season for the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, to receive his fruit.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	35	Beèe anaè a koo ñgaâa mfaè' anaè a lip moè' a yú moè', a túúshi moè' neè bluèr.	The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	36	E ker tuu ñgaâa mfaè' mo' aèñgoo a caa beèe ce e m tuu entombïì naè, beèe anaè a koo woweèe a ku gee neè woweèe aèmboè a m geèe neè ñgaâa mfaè' ce entombïì naè.	Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they treated them the same way.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	37	E lo a tuu muu yïì aè lúèsimbuèu, a laa enáê, ‘Woweèe a be yu'ni neè muu waè.’	But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, 'They will respect my son.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	38	Beèe anaè a ka' yá muu anaè, a laa a waâp mú enáê, ‘A ñwáè ce e be ye bti' na, vúè neè tá seèe yú ye, ye vi bti' anaè.’	But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, 'This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and seize his inheritance.'
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	39	Woweèe a koo ye, a fúr embe múè nsuu, a yú.	So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
Matthew	Matïìyoè	21	40	Baná ñwáè nsuu aè ka' kúti, e gee eká neè beèe ce e m láè nsuu neè woweèe anaè?”	When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?"
Yuu ce yi yu aètáèr yu ba yïû fá? Yu ba aè rlaèa ená, ‘Máè foèosi wáè efa yoè buu bbebep’, káè aè rlaèa ená, ‘Loè mbekïì, jáêr’?	For which is easier, to say, 'Your sins are forgiven;' or to say, 'Get up, and walk?'

E jèʼsi mɛ̀ nè bôr.	He has dribbled me with the ball.

Tata aè beesïì enáê, “Baná ñwáè rfaè' ce e yu ñwáâ mini a ker riñ buu foñ seê, yu nda? Yu ñwáè ce yïì masaè aè láè yïì ndap ená e ce fyá', ce fa byee neè yi ñgaâa mfaè' njep nfeè'. Beèe Farïìsi ba Jus wááwá a ka' tá suè'si mmbo aèmboè ndeèe waêp bta aè m ba ka', a ye yuu ka'.	(For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, don't eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.
Nàʼ yàa à gwè.	My cow has fallen.

a no mdip ce mi m fúú ba enje ryáá. Ryáá anaè aè m ba Jisos Kraâis ce e m ce jáèr a woweèe.	and all drank the same spiritual drink. For they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them, and the rock was Christ.
E ba kani a kʉti a byemi.	He refused and finally accepted.

Fa maè'shi tá woweèe a ker du aèmbuèu mghaèghar Juês, káè keèr yu'ni neè rsa' ce beèe ce a kani yuu mini a fa naè ka'.	not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
Pailáèt aè ka' yu' blaèa ca, a koñ ená e ba maè'shi Jisoès tá e duê. Yi ka' ba wa'a, Jus a ce waani enáê, “Wáè ka' ma'shi ñwáè ca e duê, baná aè yu ñkar Sisaè ka'. è ka'. Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!"""
Nduunjì ca zhi lɛʼ, a du mbà Mòo.	This road has branched to Moo.
Máè yá bcïìndap Nyúè saèamba ce a ke táá kuèntombïì neè Nyúè. A m fa woweèe msoèñ saèambaê.	I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
Jus a ker ba jáá efa beèe enje jáá ka'. Kraâis yu Tata neè woweèe wááwá. E ke ghoèni ñwáè wááwá ce e ka' war neè ye.	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek; for the same Lord is Lord of all, and is rich to all who call on him.
Bfee vi Nyúè vi yu jáá. E m geèe ená beèe a riñ ye ba neè bfee wap ka'. E m koèñ ená e gee beèe ce a byemi neè ye a luñ njïì enjep rfeè'shïì ce beèe a loèr aè yuu cicïì naè.	For seeing that in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom didn't know God, it was God's good pleasure through the foolishness of the preaching to save those who believe.
M ce suñ weèe máná ñgaèñ aè ka' tá naèti mbekïì fa neè ye njobeè' e yu ñkar yïì ka', baná e be naèti mbekïì fa ye yuu wááwá ce e ce roèo njobeè' e laèa a tambú.	I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.
Baná ñwáè ce e ka' tee tu neè beèe ce a ce sa' beèe, baná ñgaèñ aè teèe tu neè yuu ce Nyúè aè geèe. Beèe ce a ka' gee wa'a, baná woweèe a ce ká' ñgá' mbe waâp btuè.	Therefore he who resists the authority, withstands the ordinance of God; and those who withstand will receive to themselves judgment.
Beèe magoèr a loèr nfeè' a sañ buu ce vi m koni a seâe mú.	Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,
Bkar waê, weèe fa leèse ená noâñ mo'sir yi yu aè bsii Nyúè aèmboè bfeè' ncúèkïì, bfeè' ncúèkïì vi ba aèmboè noâñ mo'sir ka'.	But don't forget this one thing, beloved, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
Beèe mo' efa weâr mú a vúâ aè ñgoâñ Kreêt, ba aè ñgoâñ AÈrábïìyaè. Woweèe a ce suñ njáèá buu bbáèá ce Nyúè aè geèe seèe aè ce yu' aè viseèe bli wááwá.”	"Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!"""
Muu Háèrodïìyaè ce njeñwáè aè m vúè a bii bii, nyoèr aè boñ Hároèd ba beèe ce a m vúè ñkaè'. Awá Hároèd aè laèa neè muu ana enáê, “Wáè ka' bipshi ka' njáèá ká ce wáè koèñ, m ku fa neè wáè.”	"When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady, ""Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you."""
Nyúè aè m duèñshi máè buu ce aède' ñwáè aè m ba riñ ka', máè riñ vi. Máè sañ a suñ weèe mú mmo' efa gho.	how that by revelation the mystery was made known to me, as I wrote before in few words,
Pol aè du a ba' aè rla' Dábeè, a du aè rla' Listraè. Ñwáè yá'ni buu Jisos moè' aè m ba aèfo, a too ye ená Timotïì. Yïì ma aè m ba ñwáè Jus ce e m ba ñwáè rbyemïì, yïì ta aè ba yi ñwáè Greês.	He came to Derbe and Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewess who believed; but his father was a Greek.

Yïì ma aè laa neè ñgaâa mfaè' enáê, “Geèe neè yuu ce e ka' suñ weèe ená weèe geêe.”	"His mother said to the servants, ""Whatever he says to you, do it."""
Map mmir mi mú'ñgeèr, woweèe a riñ ye. A ka' rïìñ ye wa'a, e bú, woweèe a ker yá ye ka'.	Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.
E m fa buu neè ñwáè aèmboè ñger ñgaèñ yi m ba. E m fa moè' ncúèkïì taê, a fa moè' ncúèkïì baa, a fa moè' ncúèkïì moè'sir. E ka' fa, a du aè mbeè.	To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.
E lùusi sìi baa.	He has heat up cold fufu.
Láè neè mmir mbenduè buu ce Nyúè aè kaè' neè weèe, ce lu'shi. Táá neè tatap aè nfeè' ñgá', ce loo neè Nyúè, ke' ce sá ka'.	rejoicing in hope; enduring in troubles; continuing steadfastly in prayer;

Mmbañruè, koèñ neè wee bbyeèñge. Fa nyúè' neè woweèe ka'.	Husbands, love your wives, and don't be bitter against them.

When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

Mmbañruè wowo a bornïì efa rnoèñ a bbyeèñge weèe, a ce luèu aè rnoèñ ba a mmbañruè mo' weèe, a ce geèe buu ce vi yu neè rïìtu-ñwáè seê. Likewise also the men, leaving the natural function of the woman, burned in their lust toward one another, men doing what is inappropriate with men, and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error.

"In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, ""Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn't arrest me."
Bláá njáèá mnyaèa ca vi ka' ba túr ñger aè rgeèe mnyor beèe tá vi ba brara, yi ka' ba yi ká aèmboè bláá Jisos Kraâis ce vi túr ñger aè rgeèe viseèe mntee tá vi ba brara? E m loèr yïì nyor ce e m ba nrara a gee tañshïì aègho neè Nyúè a seâe btuè. E m geèe cena ba aè ñger Yú' Rara ce yi ku ba aègho aè nfeè' wááwá. Vi bláá vi túr ñger aè rgeèe tá seèe ba brara faè dïì' seèe bo geèe mfaâ' mcicïì ce aède' mi lo vúè neè rkwe ka'. E m geèe wa'a tá seèe bo faè' ba neè Nyúè ce e yu nteèe.	how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Krǎis [kɾáís] n 1a.	Christ Jesus.

Woweèe a ka' beè', a lu'shi aè njáèá ñger ce ñwaè' anaè yi fa woweèe.	When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

E m loèr mgúr anaè a cu'ni aè mkuèu Jisoès, a siñsi neè yi nyúè'tu. Ndap aè m ku rúú nsïìp nsïìp neè mgúr anaè.	Mary, therefore, took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.

Woowèe a tòo fòo banɛ wèr be dù koo mbàp.	They have burnt the bush, so we will go and catch rats.
A ker sañ mbo enáê, “Tata Nyúè rïìñ ená mkwaè'shïì beèe ce a túr bfee mi yu aè cicïì.”	"And again, ""The Lord knows the reasoning of the wise, that it is worthless."""
tá Nyúè ka' byemi, m bo vúè yá weèe neè rlu'shïì-ñwáè, tá m bo lúèshi, tá seèe yu' rboèñ.	that I may come to you in joy through the will of God, and together with you, find rest.

Fa mɛ̀ bɛbɛʼ brɛ̌r tɛ m̀ zhe.	Give me a piece of bread so that I eat.
Njeñwáè moè' ce e m cu mbe kuèu aè bfeè' ncoèp-baa-aè-rrúèú, aè vú njïì embe yeâ njïì, a joo mcúèñcúñ cáè' ese ye.	Behold, a woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years came behind him, and touched the fringe of his garment;
Tar muu ba ma muu a m yu' buu ce Simïìyoèn aè m laèa a kuu muu anaè, a bááñger seê.	Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him,
Bfúr waê, weèr ce laèa neè weèe aèlúèsimbuèu ená weèe loo neè weèr. Loo neè ená blaèa aèmboè Tata vi du aè ñgoèñ cárcár tá beèe a byemi ce yu'ni neè Nyúè aèmboè weèe aè m byemi a ce yu'ni naè.	Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified, even as also with you;
Woowèe a ba ce rì bkòr tɛ e kaʼ gher ye à ndoŋ.	They were fighting before he gripped him by the neck.
Ánoèk ce yïì ñgúè beèe aè m ba mbenjïì mñgúè beâe ntuunfu ká' embe ñgúè yïì Adaèm, aè m laèa yuu a kuu njáèá beèe ca. E m laèa enáê, “Tata be vúè a vi bcïìndap aè mncúèkïì aè mncúèkïì,	"About these also Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied, saying, ""Behold, the Lord came with ten thousands of his holy ones,"
Jisoès ba yi ñgaâa yá'ni yïì buu a ka' naèti ce duè, e du a ba' aè rla' mo', njeñwáè moè' ce a m ce too ená Maataè aè konïì ye, a niñ a ye mbe ndaèp.	It happened as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.
Jisoès aè ka' vúè baè' a yá aèmboè ñwáè anaè noèñ. E m rïìñ ená ñwáè anaè aè m yañ nfeè' njïìsaèp seê. E laa neè ye enáê, “Wáâ koèñ aè rluèñ efa yo yañ ca a?”	"When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him, ""Do you want to be made well?"""
E laa neè woweèe enáê, “Duè neè du suñ kwáèá anaè ená m be fúr byú' mnyúâmkaè' enje beèe, geèe tá ñgaâa byañ a ke'se ntïìni na ker ba aèyaèñseè, túè' moè' e keèr raa, tá m misi la rfaè'.	"He said to them, ""Go and tell that fox, 'Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission."
Má máè yu ñwáè ce m ce faè' njeptii beèe ce yap nta' yi caèa ya, a túr bsoogáè ce a yu njep máâ tïìi. M ka' laa neè moè' ená ‘Duê’, baná e be duè. M ka' laa neè moè' ená ‘Vúè’, baná e be vúè. M ka' laa neè yaè ñwáè rfaè' ená, ‘Geèe ca’, baná e be geèe yuu anaè.”	"For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, 'Go!' and he goes; and to another, 'Come!' and he comes; and to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."""
Ñwáè moè' ker ba ce aède' e gee beèe a luñ ka', njobeè' Nyúè aè ker fa ñwáè moè' njep ñgoèñ na ce aède' seèe luñ aè li rlii ka'.”	"There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!"""
Woowèe a ròo à rsèesì e ce jɛ̀r kaʼ njobe ŋwɛ̀ wɛɛwɛ ku suŋ ba zhìi ŋkoʼbùu.	They want to arrange but it is not working because everyone is just talking about his grudges.
Bfúr waê, aè m ba mbe nfeè' ce máè m vúè yá weèe naè, aède' máè m ba laa neè weèe aèmboè beèe ce a túr Yú' Nyúè njep waâp mntee ka'. Máè m laèa neè weèe ba aèmboè máâ ke laèa neè beèe ce a ce yu' rboèñ aè buu enjep ñgoèñ na. Máè m laèa wa'a njobeè' weèe aè m bii boo bká' aè buu Jisos Kraêis, weèe aè m ba aèmboè boo ce a bii nyoñ mmbee wa'a.	Brothers, I couldn't speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly, as to babies in Christ.
Máè ka' keèr fyá' a yá Muu Njeèe aèmboè e táá mbe rtuèu Sayoèn. E m táá mbo a beèe ncúèkïì rjeèe neè ncúèkïì ncoèp-kyeèe-aè-mñkyeèe. A m sañ li rlii ba rlii yïì ta nje mnsaèpsi beèe ca wááwá.	I saw, and behold, the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him a number, one hundred forty-four thousand, having his name, and the name of his Father, written on their foreheads.
Ŋwɛ̀ kaʼ gee fàa, à nashì ye.	If a person makes a mistake, you correct him.
E m fúr ñwáè ce woweèe a m ce koèñ ená e fúr embe shañ, aè ba ñwáè ce e m duè shañ njobeè' e m barsi beèe ená a tee tu neè ñkwe Ruêm, a ker yú ñwáè foñ naè. E ka' fúr, a fa Jisoès ená a gee yuu ce woweèe a m koèñ naè neè ye. Ŋkàʼ zhi be fʉʉ ba ànjɛ̌ɛkɛ?	How is the feast going to be?

AÈ m ba aè nfeè' moè' weèe aè ba aèmboè beèe ce a kweñger wa'a, njobeè' weèe aè m geèe faèa ba buu bbebep.	You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins,
A ka' teni mnsa' wáá, a lor rkwe ba ñgoèñ embaè yir a ma' njep ma mor caè. Ma mor anaè yu rkwe embenjïì.	Death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death, the lake of fire.
M ce loo máná Nyúè koosimnse neè weèe, fa weèe cumúnyañ seê, ker koñ weèe seê.	Mercy to you and peace and love be multiplied.
Wee weèe foñ yu aèmboè bluâr bteèe wa'a. Baná weèe ko'shi a yeâ geñ tá e bo loèr weèe baè'ri Ndap Nyúè yïû aè yú' aègho, tá weèe bo faè' mbo aèmboè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì ce a yu brara, a ce tañshi btañshïì ce aè yú', ce vi yu byáánïì aè bsii Nyúè njo' yuu ce Jisos Kraâis aè m geèe.	You also, as living stones, are built up as a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
Yi ka' ba wa'a, káè aè feè'shi ba máè áè, káè aè feè'shi ba beèe mo' ce a yu ñgaâa ntuu neè Jisoès foñ áè, weèr wááwá ku ce feè'shi ba yuu yi mo'sir kuu Jisos Kraêis, aè ba yuu ce weèe aè byemi foñ.	Whether then it is I or they, so we preach, and so you believed.
Mjanjaʼ mkùu mi ke tap sê.	Tiny legs are usually very strong.
a gee rtaa kúú neè bsoèpsïì a sop ye mbe tuè, a lor mbaèñ a fa neè ye mbaè bo maè'. faè dïì' ñwáè moè' bo laèa ená máè m baèptir ye a máâ rlii ka'.	so that no one should say that I had baptized you into my own name.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè Tata Jisoès ce seèe ce laèa aèmboè ye na, e m ba yi ba raèraâ jáá. Ñwáè ce e yu raèraè anaè aè m be fa' aè ñwáè tañshi tañshïì ka'.	For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe, from which no one has officiated at the altar.
Yi yu foñ ená ma beè'teè yi yu mbe seâe tar, tá ñwáè ce e koèñ aè rtuu yá weèe njo naè bo túr njïì ka', tá ñwáè ce e koèñ aè rtuu yá weèr mbena bo túr njïì foñ ka'.’	Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that none may cross over from there to us.'
Njáèá buu aèmboè bsaèkïì ba mká'ni, ba ñgeâe ñgwe, ba mbaèñ mmir aè buu yi fa keèr yu'ti a weâe mú ka', njobeè' weèe yu beèe Nyúè.	But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints;
Nduunjì ca zhi gooŋger àmbò zhǐ kù Yàa waʼa.	This road is winding like that of Ndu.
Ŋgwe cu a mɛ̌ geŋ.	The dog is sitting by me.
AÈ ka' ba aèmboè mla' Sodoèm ba Goèmoraè, mnsa' Nyúè mi m koo woweèe. Nyúè aè m toèo mla' anaè neè mor mi sheê, a kúti aè bú. E m geèe cena wa'a, a ce duèñshi ená a yuu ce yi be keè koni beèe ce a m teèe tu neè Nyúè.	and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them to destruction, having made them an example to those who would live ungodly;
Àbee yu ŋger.	Togetherness is strength.
“M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená ñwáè ce e ka' yu' ya nlaèa, byemi neè ñwáè ce e m tuu máè, baná ñgaèñ be koni ryoèñ ce nfeseè. A be sa' ñwáè anaè ka' njobeè' rkwe li keèr túr ñger mbe yeâ nduè ka'. Ñgaèñ be cu nteèe.	"Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn't come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.
John	Joân	5	25	M ce suñ weèe neè mini-ñwáè ená nfeè' ce gháá, e gháá war, ce beèe ce a kweñger a be yu' njeèndoñ Muu Nyúè. Beèe ce a be yu' njeèndoñ anaè a be cu bteèe.	Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God's voice; and those who hear will live.
John	Joân	5	26	AÈmboè ryoèñ li ke loè ese Taèr, Taèr aè geèe ryoèñ anaè li ce loè ese Muu yïì foñ,	For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.
John	Joân	5	27	a ker fa ñger neè Muu yïì foñ ená e sa' mnsa' njobeè' e yu Muu Ñwáè.	He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.
John	Joân	5	28	Weèe fa báèáñger njo' buu ce m ce suñ weèe na ka'. Nfeè' ce gháá ce beèe ce a yu njep nsheè a be yu' yïì njeèndoñ,	Don't marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,
John	Joân	5	29	fúú efa rkwe. Beèe ce a m ce geèe buu bboèñboñ a be fúú, koni ryoèñ. Beèe ce a m ce geèe buu bbebep a be fúú tá Nyúè sa' woweèe fa woweèe ñgá'.”	and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.
John	Joân	5	30	Jisoès aè ker laa enáê, “AÈde' m gee yuu mo' neè ya tu ka'. M ku ce sa' beèe ba aèmboè a m suñ máè ená m sa'. M ce sa' wa'a, ce teni mnsa' yáánïì njobeè' m ce geèe ba aèmboè m ce koèñ ka', m ce geèe ba aèmboè yaè Ta ce e m tuu máè ce koèñ ená m geêe.	I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don't seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.
John	Joân	5	31	“Yi ka' ba ená ce suñ máè aèmboè yaè nyor, yi ba yáánïì ka'.	If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid."
A m vúè neè muu anaè a fa neè ye. Yú' caè yi ka' yá Jisoès, a geêe, muu anaè aè gwe kaè', a ce biñri a ce fúr bdúdú' aè cuèu.	They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.
AÈ ka' keèr ba aè nfeè' moè', Jisoès aè ká' a ce yá'ni beèe aèwaâa roè. Ku' beèe aèñgoo se a vú a sir ye a tarte, e niñ mbe keñ a cu mbo. Beèe anaè a tááteè nje waâa roè.	Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.
Yi ba enáê, “Ñwáè aè ka' ce naèa tu, e naa ba aè yuu ce Tata aè geèe.”	"But ""he who boasts, let him boast in the Lord."""
Beèe wááwá a ku riñ ená mbañruèñwáè ka' ko'si tu, baná e coosi yi tu.	Doesn't even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?
Blúr caê, mboè ñwáè ce e geèe yuu embe nduè, ku ba ñwáè ce e geèe yuu anaè enjep mú foñ a?	You foolish ones, didn't he who made the outside make the inside also?
Ka' ba ená yuu bebep ce woweèe a m geèe naè aè m kúti ba bghoènïì neè ñgoèñ, rgweè ce woweèe a m gweè naè aè kútïì ba bghoènïì neè beèe enje jáá, baná bghoènïì ce seèe be keè koni aè nfeè' ce Jus wááwá a yu'ni neè Nyúè foñ naè, vi be keè ba magoèr aèmboè ká?	Now if their fall is the riches of the world, and their loss the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fullness?
Ŋgwe zhii zhi ke waa sê.	His dogs bark too much.
Fyá' neè wee mnyor yá ka ená weèe ce cu ba rcu ñgaâa rbyemïì a ba cu lá? Moèoshi neè weêe mnyor. Mboè weèe aè rïìñ weená Jisos Kraâis yu njep weèe, ce weèe ka' tá gweè rmoèoshïì ka' a?	Test your own selves, whether you are in the faith. Test your own selves. Or don't you know as to your own selves, that Jesus Christ is in you?--unless indeed you are disqualified.
Ñwáè aè ka' koni bghoènïì ese Nyúè njo' mncir ce e ce láè, yi ba ba ená Nyúè ce fa seèe bghoènïì anaè njo' leè' ce e m ye ka'. Geewa'a, seèe rïìñ seená Nyúè aè m ghoèni Abraèham njobeè' e m kaè' ená e be ghoèni ye.	For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no more of promise; but God has granted it to Abraham by promise.
Nyúè aè m boo mbañruèñwáè a fa neè njeñwáè ka', e m boo ba njeñwáè a fa neè mbañruèñwáè.	for neither was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.
Yuu ce m ce laèa neè beèe ce a duè bguèu wáá yi yu ená njeñwáè fa fúú ese nduu yïì ka'. Máè laèa cena neè weèe ba neè ya tu ka'. Blaèa ca yu blaèa ce vi vúè ba ese Tataê.	But to the married I command--not I, but the Lord--that the wife not leave her husband
Woweèe a yu' rboèñ, a ka'ni ená a be fa ye mbaèa.	They were glad, and agreed to give him money.
Mdip anaè mi yu aèmboè baèptir ce e ce geèe weèe ce luèñ seè'ni na. Baèptir anaè yu ba ená ñwáè ce suè'si mghaa efa nyoèr ka', yu ba ená ñwáè ce geèe mkaè'ni neè Nyúè neè ntee rara. E ce geèe weèe ce luèñ embenjïì rfúú ce Jisos Kraâis aè m fúú efa rkwe.	This is a symbol of baptism, which now saves you--not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
A ka' seèesi ená weèr Pol weèe be niñ mbe keñ ñgoèr duè aè to' Italeè, a lor Pol ba ñgaâa shañ mo' a fa neè tu neè bsoogáè rjeèe efa bkúr bsoogáè ñkwe Ruêm. A m ce too ñwáè ca ená Julïìyoès.	When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.
Boêo, yu'ni neè neè weêe bta ba weêe mma aè buu wááwá, njobeè' weèe ka' ce geèe wa'a, Tata yu' rboèñ.	Children, obey your parents in all things, for this pleases the Lord.
Seèe be ka' laèa seeká seè'ni aè? Waè' seèe yu jáá efa beèe moè' a? Yi yu wa' ka' koo múcaèr. Máè laèa wáá ená buu bbebep túr ñger mbenduè beèe wááwá, káè yu Jus áè, káè yu beèe enje jáá áè.	What then? Are we better than they? No, in no way. For we previously warned both Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin.
Cena yi ka' mïì, a fa máè ráèráñ ce a ke feè' buu aègho, a laa neè máè enáê, “Naèti duê, du fe' Ndap Nyúè, ker fe' dïì' ce a ke fa rfa mbo mbe Ndaèp Nyúè foñ. Beè' beèe ce a ce loo neè Nyúè mbe ndaèp anaè.	"A reed like a rod was given to me. Someone said, ""Rise, and measure God's temple, and the altar, and those who worship in it."
Ñgaâa mfaè' ba ñgaâa rkeè'ni Ndap Nyúè a m fyááshi mor a táá a ce yár njobeè' mbáp aè m ce fute seê. Pitaè ye ye aè m duè a táá a ce yár mor a woweèe.	Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself.
Wee beè' ñwaè' ca, weèe tuusïì neè cor ce aè rla' Laèodisïìyaè tá woweèe a bo beè' foñ. Wee weèe be' ñwaè' ce máè tuusi neè cor ce aè rla' Laèodisïìyaè naè foñ.	When this letter has been read among you, cause it to be read also in the assembly of the Laodiceans; and that you also read the letter from Laodicea.
Sá' efa rfa Nyúè yu jáá efa sá' efa yuu bebep ce ñwáè moè'sir aè m geèe. Ñwáè moè'sir aè m geèe yuu bebep, Nyúè aè sa' beèe, woweèe a gwe mnsa'. Geewa'a, beèe magoèr a ku ce geèe buu bbebep, Nyúè aè ku fa beèe rfa aè cicïì, a gee woweèe a ba byáánïì a yeâ bsii.	The gift is not as through one who sinned: for the judgment came by one to condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses to justification.
Woweèe a ma'shïì yaèp ta ce Sábáèdi a yi ñgaâa mfaè' weèe mbe keñ, a du a yeâ mbuèu.	Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.
Nyúè aè beesïì neè ye ená ká? E m beèesi enáê, “Máè bár yaè beèe ncúèkïì saèambaê, ce woweèe a loo neè Baal ka'.”	"But how does God answer him? ""I have reserved for myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to Baal."""
Woweèe a natïì a kúti aè mlaè'.	So the disciples went away again to their own homes.
E m fyá' beèe ce a m cute a sir ye mbe mú naè, a laa enáê, “Yáê, a yaè ma ba bfúr wa na.	"Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, ""Behold, my mother and my brothers!"
Máè yá máná wee ke vúè aèbee, vú ba aè rye byee Tata Nyúè ka'.	When therefore you assemble yourselves together, it is not the Lord's supper that you eat.
Máè geèe ca aè rduèñshi weèe tá wee weèe foñ bo geèe aèmboè máè geèe na.	For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.
Weèe rïìñ boèñboñ ená weèr aè m vúè tá weèr bo bu' cuèu koni yuu ese weèe ka'. Weèr aè m vúè tá weèr bo bo' beèe, koni bkuè' ka'. Nyúè rïìñ wa' foñ.	For neither were we at any time found using words of flattery, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness (God is witness),
Rbipshì anà rli jepsi mɛ̀ sê.	That question has confused me too much.
Wèr à bɛ̀rsi nduunjì tɛ mmutù bvi bo ce caŋ njo bòŋboŋ.	We have widened the road so that vehicles can drive on freely.
Yu njo' ye ce ená weèe aè byemi neè Nyúè ce e m fúr ye efa rkwe, a ku'si ye. Yi ka' ba wa'a weèe aè ce byemi ba neè Nyúè, a lá mmir ba mbe yeâ nduè.	who through him are believers in God, who raised him from the dead, and gave him glory; so that your faith and hope might be in God.
Yuu ce yi ce duèñshi ená seèe rïìñ Nyúè yi yu ená seèe ce geèe yuu ce e laèa.	This is how we know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.
Muu Njeèe ca aè ka' naèa nlaèadoñ moè', máè yu' aèmboè njeèndoñ yuu teèe mo' aè laèa enáê, “Vúè!”	"When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature saying, ""Come and see!"""

A ŋgwe ce sò à ba yɛ nà na.	This is the dog, which we saw.
Ñwáè wááwá ce e ka' ma'shi vi mndap, káè bfúr vi, káè bjar vi, káè yïì taê, káè yïì maê, káè boo vi, káè yi ñgoèñ ce e túr áè, njo' máè, e be koni ku' buu seê, caèa aèmboè e m túr naè kaèñ rjeèe, keèr koni ryoèñ ce nfeseè foñ.	Everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name's sake, will receive one hundred times, and will inherit eternal life.

a ce gheèter aè ryú ye. Nsuñ aè vú a ba' ñwáè ce e m ba tu neè bsoogáè ncúèkïì ená rla' Jáèrusaláèm wááwá li jep.	As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

M ce suñ wáè neè mini-ñwáè ená aè m ba aè nfeè' ce wáè m bii nsuènsuè ñwáè, wáè m ce kur yoè ñkaènda ce duè faèdïì' ce wáè gwáá. Byáèá ce a m taa a Jisoès weèe mbe bkïìntaa naè, a su' ye neè mcáp aè njáâá wa' foñ.	The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.
Ka' máè m ce feè'shi ba neè bfee ñwáè ka' wa'a, weèr ce feè'shi blaèa bfee neè beèe ce a bi njep múè lap rbyemïì. Blaèa ca vi loè enjep ñgoèñ na káè ese beèe ce a ce sa' ñgoèñ ca ka'. Yap ñger yi be mïì.	We speak wisdom, however, among those who are full grown; yet a wisdom not of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who are coming to nothing.
Jisoès aè beesïì enáê, “Nyúè e ke sañ, káâ' aè mú ñgaèptú' du ba' aè mbuèuñkuèr. Ñwáè aè ka' ce jáèr aè nfeè' ce ñgoèñ yi ce raa, aède' ñgaèñ koteè aè yuu ka' njobeè' ñgoèñ yi ce raa, e ce yá buu.	"Jesus answered, ""Aren't there twelve hours of daylight? If a man walks in the day, he doesn't stumble, because he sees the light of this world."

AÈ ka' ba aèmboè ñgaâa tañshi tañshïì ce a yu raèraâ Lávïì naè, ncir yi byemi ená woweèe a koo dïû' mo'sir efa bdïì' rúú efa buu jáá jáèá jáá ce beâe aè to' Isráèl a túr. AÈ ka' ba aèmboè Timotïì, weèe ku riñ yïì ndeèe. Weèe rïìñ ená e faè' weèr ye aèmboè muu e ke faè' a yïì ta naè, aè rgeèe ená Nsuñ Mboèñmboñ du kuèntombïì.	But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News.
Bfúr waê, yuu mo' tatap ce m ker ce roèo suñ weèe yi yu ená wee ce suñ buu weèe fa kaèa ka'. Weèe fa kaèa ka' aè rlii Nyúè káè aè rlii nshe ka', káè aè rlii yuu mo' ka'. Kuè laèa neè enáê, “ÁÈno” ce weèe aè ka' byemi, laa enáê, “Kaka'” ce weèe aè ka' kani, tá yi mi wa'a, faè dïì' Nyúè bo keè sa' weèe ka'.	"But above all things, my brothers, don't swear, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your ""yes"" be ""yes,"" and your ""no,"" ""no;"" so that you don't fall into hypocrisy."

Ñwáè moè' ka' kani aè rgeèe yuu ce weèr aè sañ neè weèe na, weèe fyá' ñgaèñ boèñboñ. Weèe fa túr yuu mo' aè rgeèe weèe ñwáè anaè weèe ka' tá e bo ghaèani.	If any man doesn't obey our word in this letter, note that man, that you have no company with him, to the end that he may be ashamed.
Njemor ce yi be fa woweèe ñgá' yi be mïì aè nfeè' moè' ka'. Baná yuu ce Nyúè aè ka' tarshi, ñwáè moè' fa gaèpse ka'.”	"What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate."""

e vúê, a fe'shi nsuñ cumúnyañ neè weèe ce weèe aè m ba aènjïìsaèp ker ba neè beèe ce a m ba aètútú.	He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.

Weèe ce weèe yu mmasaè, geèe neè ñgeâe boèñboñ foñ neè bkwaèa. Weèe fa ce wápsi woweèe ka'. Weèe aè ba kuushi ená weèe bkwaèa ca weèe wááwá túr Masaè moè'sir ce e ce cu mbe buèu. E ke so'niñgoèñ ka'.	You masters, do the same things to them, and give up threatening, knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no partiality with him.
Woweèe a m ce laèa wa'a, a ce kwaè'shi ená Lasoèroès ce buumi aèmboè beèe a ke buumi naè. Geewa'a Jisoès aè m ce laèa ba ená Lasoèroès aè kwe kwe.	Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep.

Rfaè' ce weèe ce geèe na li ce jaè' beèe Nyúè ce a buu yuu, a ker ce geèe beèe magoèr a ce yoèñshi Nyúè.	For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints, but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God;
Ya yú' yi ce lu'shi neè Nyúè ce e geèe máè luêñ,	My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,
Káâ' aè nfeè' ce Nyúè aè m geèe ñgoèñ, buu ce Nyúè aè m geèe vi ce duèñshi beèe buu ce aède' woweèe a m ba riñ kuu ye ka' naè. Vi ce duèñshi boèñboñ seê, ená e túr ñger ce aède' yi ke mi ka', a ker ce duèñshi foñ ená e yu Nyúè. Baná njïì moè' yu aègho ce aède' woweèe a fúr yap tu ka'.	For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.
E m ker ma' ñgaèa moè' enáê, “Ñwáè moè' aè m túr boo mmbañruè a baa.	"He said, ""A certain man had two sons."
Mɛ̀ ba fa ye mbàa, na e rìŋ mɛ̀ loo.	I would have given him money, only that he doesnʼt know me.
Wɛ̀ riŋ yuu ce koni mɛ̀ a?	Do you know what has happened to me?
A m ku ghar ye aè ñkúú. E ka' kúti a ká' ñgaâa mfaè' ce e m fa mbaèa neè woweèe naè, tá e bo yá ená woweèe a m di' gee ntaa neè mbaèa anaè a ye sá' aè mbaèa sá' lá.
